description:
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND CAKE COQUETTE. I love Love LOVE Gabby and Sharon. They were both super friendly, responsive, and helpful. My (now) husband and I came in for our wedding cake with nothing more than some mood words and a color palette. Gabby quickly gave us some guidance and had visuals to help us design dream wedding cake. She had the rendering and quote on the spot. There were no surprises or hidden conditions.

Leading up to the day of they were both patient and responsive, namely  as our guest count kept fluctuating. They delivered the cake right on time the day of. The cake was a hit and got numerous compliments from the guests. I will definitely work with them in the future for special occasions.
author: alexandria n.

description:
After looking around on yelp and contacting various bakers, Gabby and Shannon were the most responsive, informative, and professional.  I decided to go with them for my son's baptism cake since we were able to work out a design and price within my budget.  We wanted a simply designed cake that was light and not too sweet, so we went with the vanilla cake with strawberries, raspberry jam and cream cheese frosting.

Shannon and her assistant delivered around our requested time, and they helped set up the cake on the table.  

Now onto the cake- our guests raved about how good it was and were impressed with the design as well.  I personally loved the cake- just the perfect amount of sweetness.

Thanks, Cake Coquette!  It was a smooth process and I'm happy to have hired them.
author: Abby D.

description:
Repeated customer. 

I had the pleasure of working with Gabby for my wedding cake so it was only right to work with her for my daughter's 1st birthday. 

We ordered the white cake with salted caramel and toffee bits. SO GOOD! The cake was perfect! The kids loved the giraffe that sat on top (see pic.) 

Thank you again Gabby!
author: Serena F.

description:
This is my first time booking with cake coquette for a birthday cake, and they have sold me. I will definitely be coming back for my next cakes.

I had called in a week and half early to book this cake for my friends birthday cake. Everything was online and email, so as a first timer, I was a little scared that something would have went wrong. However, everything turned out perfect. The staff was so intricate with every detail. 

Cake: I had opted for the vanilla cake with strawberries and raspberry jam. I would definitely get this again one day. The cake was super moist with the perfect quantity of raspberry and strawberries. I usually don't like heavy fondants on my cake or heavy frosting, and cake coquette does not have that! We all enjoyed eating this cake, great job cake coquette!

Staff: gabby and Shannon had helped me, they're both very nice and sweet! Great job at decorating the cake guys! We loved it!
author: Elsa W.

description:
If you really think they are as good as one of the most expensive bakeries should be - you are very much wrong. I ordered birthday cake for my wife's party. Aaaaand it was disaster! Main theme of cake was totally ignored and manager Apologized after I picked up "sorry we forgot". Again, main THEME of the cake was "forgotten". I paid $300 for
This little cake for 15 people.. looked very goofy too. Cake looked like something i would take to my kids kindergarten birthday celebration and NOT on my wife's fancy party at the high end club. Couldn't be more disappointed..
author: Mikey V.

description:
I was a little early booking my wedding cake (11 months) but Gabby and her team were so accommodating. I met with her in person once to go over my ideas for our cake and to do the cake tasting.

I changed my mind a lot in terms of the design and felt bad but Gabby and her team were nothing short of friendly and helpful. They really do want you to have the cake of your dreams!

I couldn't have imagined it turning out any better. We picked the hazelnut chocolate cake with rum and then the classic vanilla with amaretto soaked cake. Since we had children at our reception we asked for the top tier to be no alcohol and to have funfetti cake. 

My only regret is not being able to have each of the flavors at our wedding (we were so busy!). The bites that we did have of the classic white were moist, flavorful, and effing delicious! I can't wait for our anniversary when we return to SF; we will have to order our cake again!
author: Lilee N.

description: We ordered a two tier vegan cake with 3D characters. The cake arrived on time and was not only delicious but a beautiful centerpiece at my sisters vegan baby shower we order for 75 and had more than enough left over.
author: Shan T.

description:
The cake was amazing.  Super team to work with. I sent a picture of Woebot my company's bot and Gabrielle and her team made an amazing cake.  I can't recommend this team highly enough.  Enjoy your party and your cake.  We just need how to figure out a reason to have another cake made!

Fabulous cake design and super delicious Cake.
author: Regina O.

description:
This review is long overdue. Thank you to Gabby and her assistant, Shannon. They really made the process a breeze and the cake was better than expected.

The cake was such a big hit!!! My boyfriend DJ's at a club called New Wave City once a month. I brought the cake there and everyone had such amazing comments. Everyone thought the cake was tasty and that the cassette tape was spot on. When I took it out of the box I felt like the cake was on the red carpet; all were taking out there phone's and took pictures. I was taking questions on behalf of the cake!

Anyway, my boyfriend loved it and we froze a chunk of it so when we got back from NY State it be home for him to pig out on. The cake still tasted just as good as when we first got it!

Attached are some pics. I will definitely be back!!!
author: Christine E.

description: Hands down the best option for wedding cakes or cupcakes. We had a tasting with Gabby and we quickly realized that we loved all of the flavors. We had a vision and Gabby seriously brought it to life. We could not have been happier with taste and the presentation. Everything was perfect from start to finish. To any brides or grooms out there searching for a cake - this is your vendor.  Shannon and Gabby are a wonderful team!  The cake was perfect and our guests devoured the cupcakes. Nothing left
author: Robert T.

description:
We challenged Gaby with a concept cake for our wedding reception. We emailed her a few photos for inspiration then she met us at her office and sketched the design on the spot that beautifully combines the elements together. 

We also bought their trial kit (one slice of cake per each of their flavours) to decide on the cake flavour. We continued emailing in the coming weeks, Gaby and her assistant Shannon responded to our emails in a few hours. The whole experience was professional. 

The cake was the highlight of our night. It was very very pretty! And you don't expect such an artistic cake to also taste good, in fact it was the best chocolate cake I have ever had!

Can't thank you enough Gaby.
author: Revna A.

description:
This was my first time looking for a custom cake. I e-mailed several places, but ended up going with Gabby and her team thanks to their quick response and creativity.

We asked for a grumpy cat inspired cake, and were expecting something much more simple than the amazing cake Gabby delivered. The cake ended up being the highlight of our party. And not only did it look #grumpy, it tasted amazing :)
author: Patrick I.

description:
We decided to hire Cake Coquette to create our wedding cake after reading numerous reviews and doing enough tastings to make me gain 5 pounds. We were looking for something that seems to be difficult to find, a wedding cake that looks amazing and tastes even better than it looks. After tasting Gabrielle's delicious creations and watching her sketch our dream cake before our very eyes, we knew that Cake Coquette was the obvious choice. We selected the Chocolate Raspberry Cake and the Classic White Cake to give people a couple options. 

The cake was beautiful and more than a dozen people came up to me to tell me that it was the best wedding cake they had ever had. The Chocolate Raspberry Cake was particularly popular. The cake was moist and decadent and the raspberry and fudge filling was delicious. I would highly recommend Cake Coquette for a cake for any occasion!
author: Karl S.

description: 4th time ordering from Gabby & team, and they've hit it out of the park each time!  This latest cake is my favorite of the bunch - a stunning rendition of the Castro Theatre that tasted as great as it looks.  Communication and customer service was superb once again.  Can't wait for another occasion to order one of Gabby's magnificent creations!
author: Don C.

description: Whole team is wonderful. They are very nice to answer any of your questions, communication with you immediately. In all, everything is just so prefect! The cake is also delicious! Love it!
author: Yang Z.

description:
I have never had such a positive and smooth experience with a custom cake design. Gabby and her team were professional, responsive, and very easy to email. I had a custom "donut theme" 30th birthday and wanted a fabulous cake to go with it. All my correspondence with Gabby was via email. I explained to her my idea and sent a photo of my cake topper and desired flavor of cake. I was a bit nervous since everything was over email, but I was ECSTATIC when I saw the final product on my birthday.
The cake was cute and delivery was early to the venue I was hosting at. At my party, everyone was raving not only about the design but also the taste of the cake! The frosting was perfect and the cake was nice and moist. I had a red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting. 

Being born in December, I have been getting red velvet cakes every birthday since I was little. This was by far the best one I have had.

Thank you again Gabby and Talya! I will be using you again for future events.
author: Angela I.

description:
So glad I chose Gabby to create a cake for my baby shower! I sent her an email with a example of what I wanted for the nautical theme and she said she would modify the design to fit within my budget. I was expecting something way less elaborate than the photo I sent her but it turned out to be exactly how I had wanted it! Not only was it beautiful, it was moist and the vanilla with raspberry and strawberry filling was well-balanced, fresh, and not too sweet. My guests raved about it and kept asking where the cake was from and did not hesitate to take all of the leftovers home with them! Majority of the time bakeries put so much time and effort on the outside of the cake, the inside and the taste gets compromised, but not with my cake! 

She offers delivery service for a fee but I opted to pick the cake up myself at no charge and she was communicative and made it a breeze. Will definitely order my next cake from her! Worth every penny!
author: Vivian D.

description:
I found Cake Coquette online, and after reading all these amazing Yelp reviews, decided to reach out to them about creating a custom Darth Vader cake for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. I communicated with them over email, and they were so responsive and helpful at every step. When the cake finally arrived yesterday morning, I was so stoked--my expectations were met and exceeded! The cake looked awesome. My boyfriend loved it so much, he was reluctant to cut into it cos it "looked so good!" When we finally cut into it, it was just as delicious as it looked! 

Thank you so much Gabrielle and team for the awesome cake! I'll definitely be ordering from you again.
author: Kryshana A.

description: My wedding cake was not only beautiful, it was also DELICIOUS and the top tier was made vegan because I am vegan. Honestly, it was even better than I remember from the tasting. My husband and I even went over to my parents house the next day and had leftover cake for breakfast! It's been a challenge saving two pieces for my husband and I to eat for our 1 year anniversary :) cake Coquette was so professional and had very reasonable prices. Plus when you do your tasting you can stop by Bare Bottle before or after for a celebratory beer!
author: K J.

description: Cake Coquette baked the cake for our wedding and it was everything I had dreamed of! I had an idea of what I wanted for the cake and had a few inspiration pictures, but at our tasting Gabby worked with us to create a custom cake plan from our ideas. Seeing what it looked like when it came to life was one of the things I was so excited about for our big day! Gabby and Sharon were amazing along the way, very responsive, friendly, and super helpful when we had questions!! The cake was delivered on time and was so so beautiful!!!! Several people remarked on how beautiful our cake was and EVERYONE could not stop talking about how delicious it was!! Seriously the BEST wedding cake I have ever had!!! I highly highly recommend Cake Coquette and if you are at all considering them for a cake for your party, wedding, occasion, etc then do yourself a favor and at least go in for a tasting and see for yourself why everyone is raving about these cakes!!!
author: Tayler M.

description:
Thank you Gabby Feuersinger for my dream 
SF Giants baby shower cake! The attention to details of the perfectly colored orange fondant, the intricacies of the "stitching" of the glove , the "wood" like bat and adorable SF cap were just spectacular! And you and your staff did this just from a photo I got off of Pinterest! You and Madison were friendly, polite and so professional! The courier service you used delivered the cake on time and in perfect condition. Thanks again! I will definitely use your services again for more special occasions.
author: Julie G.

description:
Ordering: has been a piece a cake. All arrangements are by email. We told Gabby we are having a bow tie lamb theme and they made it happened. Overall they reply quickly. 

Delivery: $70 to Daly City. Talya carefully assembled where we like the cake to be presented. It was so beautiful and it came out exactly the way we wanted.

Cake: We had a 2 tier cake and a 3D Lamb (made from rice crispy) topper. It was the cutest cake we ever seen. The taste on the other hand was overly sweet (raspberry puree, vanilla buttercream, cut strawberries) and the white cake was a bit dense and dry. 

Overall good looking cake on the outside but quality of the cake is just okay.
author: Will And Summer C.

description:
Gabby and her team at Cake Coquette are "as good as it gets" on so many different levels (A++++++!!!!).  
We have used Gabby four or five times over the past two years or so, and each time are more and more impressed with her teams professionalism, incredible (and delicious) artistic/baking skills and her entire operation as a whole at Cake Coquette.  
Every time I have put in a cake request,  one of her team members will immediately reply with a friendly, professional, and creative response.
Last week, I put in a last minute custom cake request (complete with my sisters boutique logo, attention to small and creative details, details, details! throughout, anniversary number topper (boutiques second anniversary), and absolutely delicious Devils Food Chocolate cake with Mocha fudge filling) on Wednesday afternoon and needed ready by Friday morning.  She squeezed us in and the cake was ready first thing Friday morning.  As always, the cake was absolutely stunning (especially impressive for a last minute squeeze in).
Gabby and her team surprise me each time I pick up a new cake with relevant, innovative, artistic, clever and not to mention DELICIOUS! cakes.
Also, the price (to me) is extremely reasonable for a gorgeous, delicious, and stunning cake - which literally looks like a work of art, or looks too REAL to be a cake.
Gabby's cakes make a fantastic (and tasty) addition to any gathering, and provide a stunning gift to whoever is lucky enough to receive this mouth watering masterpiece.
Gabby- thank you for continuing to produce amazing and delicious cakes - SF is lucky to have you, and your cakes have become a tradition tat all of our family birthdays and events!!
Keep up the great work and thank you for the amazing cakes!!
author: Jake T.

description: Cake Coquette went so above & beyond and made my son's graduation celebration that much more special. I emailed on Wed for a cake on Sun, understanding that it was super short notice. Gabrielle told me that they would probably only be able to do a single level cake. So I was THRILLED to walk into the restaurant and find this amazing cake had been delivered! Thank you!!!
author: Miren A.

description: I was impressed by their cake photos and reviews so I took a chance and ordered my best friend's baby shower cake from Cake Coquette. Customer service was friendly enough, but they would only communicate through email, never by phone even when I left voicemails, which was fine with me as long as they replied. I sent over 3-4 photos of the cake design I wanted and was specific in my email when finalizing the design. I wanted a small elephant on top of the cake with a balloon. The final cake design had a huge elephant (I'm talking 4-5 times the size of the photos I sent) on top of it with no balloon. The cake tasted good, not delicious, not bad, but decent. I flew in from LA, picked up the cake attended the baby shower and flew back home so I didn't feel the need to contact Cake Coquette about my disappointment in the design, but I'm writing this review so that others who are ordering make sure to follow up on your cake design to ensure that you get what you want. Especially bc they are not cheap and I paid over $200 for the cake. I've attached two photos to show what I wanted and what I got. The scale was completely off. Overall, bc the cake actually tasted decent and bc the customer service was good, I can't say that the experience was all bad. I'm just used to excellent cake design and this was a disappointment.
author: Mary B.

description: I give this place a 5 star I ordered a minions cake for my kids and they made it exactly like the picture and I emailed them to order the cake they emailed me within the next day. The flavors I ordered was chocolate and red velvet and they both where so good, I would definitely recommend this place to someone. They do a great job. I'm satisfied with the cake and they're work.
author: Lilian L.

description: Thank you again soooooooo much!!! This is the 5th cake and we keep coming back. The details were amazing and flavors were great! You never disappoint and I will continue to be a loyal customer and keep recommending Cake Coquette!!!
author: Anne A.

description: Fantastic decorating.   Outrageously expensive. Cake was NOT good.  Shouldn't be hard to get a good cake underneath all the nice artistry of the fondant and gumpaste work.   And certainly for the price I don't think a good cake is asking too much.  Cake was lemon but too dry and not enough lemons flavor.  So if you are going for looks and have money to burn hey it's a good place - maybe get a great tasting cake to go with it from somewhere else.
author: Chris H.

description: we had a 2 tiered fly fishing / mountain themed cake for our wedding in Tahoe. Guests loved it and we received nothing but wonderful compliments that we want to relay to Gabby. thank you so much for your great work. Picked up the cake on Friday and we brought it to Tahoe.
author: Sophia N.

description: I was so excited to have Cake Coquette create my beautiful wedding cake! Not only did Gabby and her team produce exactly what I was looking for, it was insanely delicious. Plenty of the guests commented that it was the best cake that they had ever had (I would have to agree with them!). The cake was a two tier red velvet, white fondant and included succulents. I've also worked with Cake Coquette previously on a specialty cake for a work event where we were celebrating the kick off of an important partnership. That was also a smashing success. Cake Coquette is and will be my go-to boutique for cakes and desserts for all occasions. Thank you again!!!
author: Jackie J.

description: Wow, what an amazing, seamless experience we just had.  I emailed extremely last minute, requesting a 50 person Peppa Pig cake (!) for my daughter's 3rd birthday. I received an immediate response, she had a perfect photo from a past cake to show me for comparison, and we were good to go.  Fast forward to about a week later, the cake was delivered to our house right on time, and we were all set. I cannot tell you how delicious this cake was (vanilla with strawberries and raspberries) and how beautiful it was (unbelievable). The compliments from guests didn't stop coming. Everyone needed to know WHERE this amazing cake was from and hopefully as a result we have sent some more business their way. Will definitely go to them again.
author: Sasha L.

description: We couldn't have been more happy with our wedding cake! We had a 20's, Great Gatsby themed wedding and from Cake Coquette's website, I knew that they would do a fabulous job on a non-traditional wedding cake. The cake flavors were amazing and the design came out better than we had hoped for. Gabby is really talented and came up with a sketch just from talking to us for a few minutes during our cake tasting. I had sent her an image of our initials the week before and she transformed the center of the cake to match the image. Just loved it! We had SO many compliments from guests at our wedding.
author: Elyse L.

description:
If I could put zero stars I would. 
My company had a 10 anniversary party with all of our most important guests and executives from out of the country. Needless to say I wanted the cake to be perfect. Similar to the quality cakes I've seen on Yelp and their website.  I've expressed the importance of making sure the cake is perfect. After all I'm spending a tiny fortune on a custom cake. The cake was supposed to be shaped like a solar project with solar panels on a desert. What I received was a cake with solar panels that were uneven, jagged lines and icing stains on the ribbon. They didn't even have the decency to cut our logo straight. The final project was rushed and looked like an amateur made it. That was just the exterior. The cake itself was supposed to be caramel creme. I am not a professional baker, but I know enough that the caramel was burnt as it had sugar crystals in the icing.  My customers and colleagues were asking if it was a peanuts butter cake because they saw "peanut-like" objects in the icing.  Very embarrassing to say the least. 
Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Jeanny D.

description:
I'm so glad I chose Cake Coquette for our wedding, as they worked with our budget and were very good about answering emails and phone calls. The cake design was exactly what we wanted, absolutely beautiful  It definitely added a special touch of decoration to our reception. 

Because our cake was so small, we had to get to sheet cakes as well. We got chocolate mocha for the actual cake and one sheet cake and then white strawberry for the second sheet cake. Unfortunately the chocolate cake we loved at the tasting did not taste as great at the party. I was pretty bummed, because it was so great at our tasting in April (wedding was this past Dec 2nd) However, my husband later told me that guests who had the white strawberry cake said it tasted really good. 

Any who, overall I'm glad we chose Cake Coquette aside from the chocolate not being quite as tasty as we had hoped. 

Thanks for making our wedding beautiful!
author: Laura A.

description:
We ordered my daughter first birthday cake and it turned out AMAZING! We wanted the cake to match our Dr. Seuss theme and it was perfect. I am gluten intolerant, and wanted to be able to enjoy the cake as well and Gaby was able to accommodate this. The cake was honestly the best gluten free cake I've ever tasted! We got so many complements on the cake and it was most definitely worth the cost! 

I really really really want to give this 5 stars but the cat in the hat's neck on our cake was broken before we even got home. We were able to prop it up with a skewer but I feel like it was a bit of an eyesore. The cake looked amazing regardless but I wish that part was a bit more sturdy.
author: Skye G.

description:
Gabby's cake was impeccable everyone was in love with the design 
You did it !!!! 
If you looking for a place to order a cake with a theme an idea this lady is your best option.
author: A. M.

description: One the most beautiful and delicious birthday cakes I have ever seen!  I hired these guys to custom design a cake for 12-16. I gave them a picture of my husband walking his dog on the beach at sunset and they PERFECTLY recreated the picture around be sides of the cake. HANDS DOWN the best cake makers in San Francisco. Extremely professional, reliable and super nice throughout the entire process.
author: Billy P.

description:
This is by far the best cake I've ever seen and tasted!! We ordered cake for our Pastor's birthday. The ordering process was smooth. I've told Gabby that we want some cake with Bible and she response with the design she had in mind (this was on her first email). And it was very detailed! You could tell that she really loves what she does just from the way she emails. SHE BAKES WITH LOVE!

She asked about the background of our church and pastor. She wanted the cake to represent our church and Pastor (I didn't think that far! Seriously I was just thinking of a Bible cake and that's it) I couldn't even imagine how could she put all those in the cake but SHE DID! I can't explained them with words so I'll just post the pictures here.. 

The taste was so good! I ordered the red velvet. It was moist and not too sweet.. On the day of our Pastor was so amazed by the details of the cake and the congregation love how it taste! It was definitely a big hit!!

Thank you Gabby and Talya for your assistance! You guys are amazing and very talented! Keep up the good work..
author: Pink J.

description: I've had the pleasure of working with Gabby and her team two more times when I ordered a Bumgarner cake for my husband's 40th birthday and more recently, a Tinkerbell cake for my daughter's first birthday.  The details on the Bumgarner cake was pretty awesome and the Tinkerbell cake was simply beautiful.  It is always easy to work with Gabby and she always deliver as promised.
author: Le T.

description:
Gabby is just amazing. She creates masterpieces out of cake. She just made the cake for my wedding today, and I couldn't be happier! I asked for a small 3 tier cake, we went with her lemon cake with a textured buttercream frosting, and it was absolutely delicious and beautiful. I will post some photos when I get them back from my photographer :)

Gabby was very quick to email me back when I had questions, helpful when I picked up a sample box of flavors, and very easy to deal with. If I ever need another cake, Cake Coquette will be my first call :)
author: Angel A.

description: Gabby baked the birthday cake for our sons 1st and 3rd birthday parties! It's been such a pleasure working with her - she has made his visions of dinosaurs and Stitch come alive and also made the yummiest chocolate cake ...that was vegan and nut free. I'd recommend her in a heartbeat !
author: Tina R.

description:
I am so disappointed when I see the cake I ordered for my friend.
First, the color of the cake. I wanted chocolate flavor but white outside. So I mentioned explicitly, I want a white cake with small pink flowers decorating. They replied 'Sounds great for flavor choice, and yes the outside of the cake will be white buttercream underneath the various shades of pink sugar flowers and gold leaves', but when I see the cake, it was a RED PINK cake, so different! I even attached the cake, but they just don't pay attention at all!
Then I asked for a delicate small rabbit on cake. I didn't have a concrete picture sent to them, my bad to trust their design- a BIG YELLOW  stupid rabbit sitting on top of red pink cake. It's just so ugly!
And they don't even have a box fitting the cake, very bad experience.
I cannot believe I spent $200 on this stupid cake! Will never order from them again!
author: X X.

description: My husband and I recently had a small wedding at city hall in San Francisco. Initially we weren't going to have a wedding cake but the week prior we decided we wanted a small cake for the traditional cake cutting. Cake Croquette came to the rescue! They were one of the only bakeries willing to do a small cake at the last minute. They were very responsive by email. We chose to have a hazelnut flavored cake with chocolate and hazelnut ganach filling. Because this was so last minute, we did not get to do a cake tasting beforehand but the cake was delicious and it turned out beautifully! I will definitely be going to them for my future cake needs!
author: Vanessa M.

description: Gabby was so awesome to work with. We had the pleasure of meeting her before our wedding this past month when we went in for a cake tasting. Her shop was very cool and she had so many great samples for us to choose from. The design she created for us was amazing. She listened to exactly what we asked for and then went 100 steps beyond to create the perfect wedding cake for us. It tasted amazing and all of our guests loved the design. I highly recommend Gabby. She is professional responsive and an amazing artist. Thank you Gabby so much!i
author: M K.

description: Loved my wedding cake! I went to A LOT of cake tastings and Gabby's was by far the best one. Tons of flavors to choose from and beautiful artistry in the designs. I had a hard time finding a shop that 1) would make gum paste flowers and 2) made them well. Cake Coquette definitely hit the mark! I ended up getting the vanilla cake with raspberry jam, cream cheese filling and fresh strawberries in a 4-tier cake AND a sheet of the hazelnut flavor to serve approx 300 people. I didn't want any fondant so I went with buttercream. Delicious! Everyone enjoyed it and I didn't have much left over. If I could re-do the wedding cake, the only thing I would have changed is ordering a 5-tier (instead of 4-tier) cake! I can't wait for our wedding anniversary; we decided to re-order the same flavors for our anniversary cake!
author: Grace L.

description:
Gabby and her team really did amazing job for our wedding. They deserve all the complimentary. 

Since I live in China, and it's an overseas wedding, it was impossible for us to meet face to face before the wedding, and I also couldn't go to their store or workshop for sample taste; besides, we have 15-hour jet lag, all the communications were made in emails. However, our communications were very smooth and efficient, since Gabby's team was very professional. Normally I sent out emails during daytime in our time zone, and I could always get her feedback next morning on time. What I did was sent to them sample pictures I liked and asked them if they were able to do the similar thing and told them how many guests we had. Gabby would suggest the size of our wedding cake, provide different favors they had and estimate the total cost. We didn't encounter any problems during our communication. Gabby took down all my detailed requests in different emails, and didn't miss one single item. And all the payments had been cleared before the wedding, which was really efficient and straightforward.

On the wedding day, I didn't have chance to meet any staff from Cake Coquette; when they came and did preparation, I was taking my wedding photos outdoor. When I was ready for the reception, my wedding coordinator told me that everything was set, including the wedding cake, cupcakes and cookies.  As I walked into the restaurant, I was definitely impressed by the beautiful wedding cake as well as those very exquisite desserts. All these items were made exactly as same as the picture I provided. I had to say that their workmanship was perfect, which making the cake table a shining point on my wedding. And they looked so pretty in the lens, please check those lovely pictures. The style and color matched the soft ambient uplighting perfectly. Besides, the cake and desserts were also very tasty. We even brought the rest of cake to our after party and we really liked the chocolate favor. 

I was so glad that my wedding was such a big success, because overseas wedding is certainly not an easy job. And Cake Coquette definitely contributed lots of efforts on that. I really appreciate their exquisite services. I also feel sorry because I didn't have chance to thank their staff personally, to avoid disturbing us, they just came and left quietly. So it's our obligation to write down our appreciation online and say thanks to all the staff from Cake Coquette. Well done!
author: Jessie W.

description:
Gabby made our wedding cake and I was completely blown away by her talent. We met with her and brought a few photos and described what we wanted. As we sat there tasting and discussing what we wanted, she sketched out our cake and it looked perfect. The actual cake could not have turned out better. She made us exactly what we had envisioned and it was so beautiful and tasted great. And her prices are not bad either! 

You can see photos of the cake here on my blog, the photos are toward the end so you'll see them if you scroll to the bottom of the post: 

http://www.pacificavenueblog.com/2014/09/our-wedding-part-ii.html
author: Darah P.

description: By far the best cake I've ever had! Reached out to Gabby for a last minute cake for our small SF City Hall Wedding reception and she was able to work with me on the design, flavor, and delivery of the cake. We didn't get to see it until it was served and all the oohs and ahhs in regards to the cake were never ending. The flavor was superb! Simple, elegant, and tasty. I can't wait for our next event so I can order from her again :)
author: Sonali S.

description:
My review/tip/picture keeps getting removed........ 

The look of my sons 1st birthday cake was exactly how i sketched and asked for it to look like. It was the best looking cake i have ever had. She was very nice and easy to work with and i only gave her about a week notice and she was still able to make a cake for me.... BUT the cake tasted horrible.... the cake i ordered was with vegan butter cream but that shouldn't be a reason for it to taste as nasty as it did. I never knew a cake could taste so bad... The fondant smelled and tasted like play dough, the  vanilla cake tasted like nothing, and the chocolate vegan butter cream tasted like watered-down  peanut butter clay.....2 stars for the nice LOOK of the cake, -3 for the (1) horrific taste, (2) extremely high price (for the size and taste!), (3) not being able to taste test ANY cakes from her beforehand.
author: Jazmin B.

description:
Gabby created the rustic wedding cake of my dreams! Many of my guests said that it was the only wedding cake they've eaten that actually tasted delicious.  And they were right! She made me a special Italian Creme Cake just for this Southern gal, even though she hadn't made it before.  But it was perfect.  

She was very easy to work with and she helped me stay in my budget.  She took care of the delivery and made my special day stress-free.  You can't go wrong with Cake Coquette! I have photos I'll post on Yelp.
author: Deanna C.

description: I ordered an expensive $185 cake for my friend's wedding shower and it was so pretty I didn't want her to cut it! We ordered a 8" round gold cake with sugar flowers. Vanilla cake with raspberry jam and strawberries, cream cheese frosting. Everyone loved the cake, it was good, I think I have very high expectations and wish it was just a tad more moist. But the detailing of each flower was crazy. I would recommend them. Oh and I asked for a cake to feed up to 12 people, we had almost half left over. It was a tall cake!
author: Karen T.

description:
The 1st. Cake I bought from here was 3 years ago. By far the best cake I've ever tried. 3 different flavors and very affordable it cost me $260,But I definitely felt it was worth it. The cake was moist and it taste very fresh. ( The flavor were Lemon,chocolate ganache and clasic white cake.)
Now the reason that I'm giving 1 star is because 3 years later this past Oct 30 2016 I purchase a cake again. It look amazing very pretty decoration,but that's it. The cake tasted  like it's been refrigerated for days and very dried. I was definitely expecting the same quality and I order the same flavors as last time. I said to myself I can't go wrong with the flavors I already tasted in the past. But I  felt very disappointed because this time I dare to paid $400 Alot of money for just the cake so I was defenetly expecting a product worth the money I paid. 
I won't be buying from this place anymore.
author: Melina M.

description: From the very beginning Gabby has been very nice and helpful with me. I got a shopkins cake with cupcakes for my daughters 5th bday. It was a hit. Everyone wanting to eat more of the cake, and theyre saying that it was the best tasting cake they ever had. I'm really happy and I would love them to do more cakes for us. T
author: Chaerin A.

description:
Gabby made our wedding cake for our wedding in June. She was great to work with.  The first time we met, we were impressed by how she really listened to our ideas about how we wanted our cake to look and was able to sketch out a design incorporating all our ideas on the spot. The cake tasting was delicious as well!  It was hard to choose what flavor we wanted because there were so many delicious ones, but we ended with up with the chocolate and citrus. 

The cake ended up being pretty amazing.  Our cake was decorated with sugar flowers. The detail on the sugar flowers was pretty amazing.  Thank you gabby for such a beautiful cake!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Gabby's cake was amazing! I had originally requested for a vegan carrot cake for my daughter's 1st birthday, which she had no problem with making, but I later changed my mind and requested for a regular carrot cake. She had no problems with making either. I also changed my mind about the size later, which she readily accommodated for. The cake was moist and absolutely delicious and looked exactly like how I wanted it to, even though I didn't give very specific instructions! I requested for a pastel colored farm animal/barnyard theme, and the cake was beautiful!!  She responded promptly to email and was super easy to work with. I initially had reservations about spending so much on a cake, but I think it was totally worth it.
author: Verna L.

description:
We were in love with the wedding cake my husband and I received from Cake Coquette. Gabby was absolutely wonderful to work with and had patience with me and my ever changing cake/cupcake requests. Im an Event Manager who loves the lovely little details, so you can just imagine how extremely accommodating Gabby really was. The cake was absolutely delicious not to mention beautiful. 

Cake Coquette does a wonderful job and listens to your every request. Cant thank you enough!!
author: Ashley G.

description:
Gabby made our dream come true!!

My husband and I got married two weeks ago and we looooveed over cake! I as any bride would went crazy on Pinterest and looked all these gorgeous cakes and was convinced that no one would be able to recreate them, that's until I met Gabby.

When we first met her, she was professional and timely and had all the flavor's laid out for us to try. My husband being the "expert", on cakes he was in charge of that while Gabby and I discussed looks and I showed her my page and prayed she wouldn't say no. Within a couple of minutes, she has the image sketched and added special touches of her own for our 4 tier cake. We loved the flavor we chose and the design and went out of their almost skipping. A couple of days later, I couldn't resist, but ask if we can make it 5 tiers and the top one being a different flavor, within a day or so, Gabby replied to my email to confirm that's not a problem. She not only responds timely, which I think other vendors should take note of, but she also says almost "yes", to everything. Then the day of the wedding came and when we saw the cake, we were beyond ecstatic! It was beautiful and to this day everyone keeps asking me who made our cake and how good it tastes. I can only offer my thanks and this glowering review to Gabby. You really can't go wrong if you choose her.

Thank you so much!

Tseday and Paul
author: Tseday A.

description: Gabby is awesome! I needed a custom cake for my brother's send-off-to-grad-school party, and she totally made my vision come to life! Theme, detail, colors, and everything about the cake was beyond amazing! The guests couldn't believe it was a cake, and my brother didn't even want to cut into it. I would definitely go to Gabby again! THANK YOU, Gabby!
author: Valerie M.

description:
There is probably not an easier way to order a masterpiece of a cake than working with Cake Coquette. From the initial inquiry to the final delivery the service is top notch.

I ordered a cake for my company to celebrate our IPO. I wanted something  unique that people would remember. And did they? Most definitely yes.

The artisans at Cake Coquette created a delicious multi layer cake with the stock ticker around the sides and our symbol on top next to the bell. The highlight however was the Wall Street bull sculpture busting out of the side of the cake. The bull was simmering in bronze.

The cake was delicious and photographed all during the party. I can't say enough good things about this company. True professionals!
author: Joe S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I am VERY picky when it comes to bakeries.  My mom owned a bakery when I was growing up and I never thought I'd find a cake I liked as much as hers...until I tried Cake Coquette!  They did my wedding cake on 6/22 and it was not only the most beautiful cake I've ever seen, but also really delicious!  My mom (who is even more picky than I am) was so impressed!!  She commented to me, "Now THAT is a good cake!"  They also made us cupcakes with flowers on the top that were AMAZING!  

We got tons of compliments on our cake!  Thanks so much, Gabby and Talya!!
author: Christina M.

description: I had  a major life tragedy and had to cancel my order and was charged a $50.00 fee, I could understood if there was a tasting but there was nothing but taking an order, instead of letting the tragic event take place Gabby wanted to put salt in a wound, I could of been a great future customer and refer from my many friends and fans, but she thinks it right to charge for having to cancel? Now I have to possibly shout this out to over 10 million fans via Bravo TV, Facebook & Twitter in the coming weeks, it will make for great TV though, what the producers say
author: Blu M.

description: Talya at Cake Coquette made our cake tasting very easy and she was so helpful and friendly.  She worked closely with our florist to ensure the final look of our cake with orchids cascading down the tiers was exceptional!  The Citrus buttermilk cake with Citrus cream and Blueberry preserves was simply delicious!!  We highly recommend Cake Coquette!  Wayne and Anthony
author: Wayne D.

description:
Talya and Gabby put together a beautiful wedding cake exactly to our taste with no hassle whatsoever.  Cake Coquette has simple pricing and puts together a great product.

We opted for a "naked" cake and simply provided 3 photos of cakes that were similar to what we wanted.  The team executed the perfect blend of the photos and delivered a spectacular cake that not only looked beautiful but tasted even better--vanilla cake and salted caramel icing with broken toffee pieces.  Our guests devoured the entire cake, many eating a second or third slice.

When we walked into the wedding venue to see what they had delivered we could not have been happier with the product.  5 stars and a great deal of thanks to Cake Coquette!
author: Wesley W.

description:
Gabby is a truly talented cake baker. We had initially planned to use her for our wedding in August, but we decided to push up the wedding due to a family member's health. Not only did Gabby redo the cake plan entirely (from two tier tiny presentation cake to a three tier cake for 70 people!) but she also made it work so that her fee would be covered by the initial deposit we made. Her cakes are scrumptious and her professionalism is fantastic, you can't go wrong!
P.S. We had initially planned on doing cupcakes as well, so don't assume Cake Coquette is a one trick pony! ;-)
author: Catherine C.

description: This review is a year late, but after our cake experience this year I realized I didn't review last years' cake!  Gabby made the most amazing custom cake for us last year. My kid was having a "Peg+Cat" party and we wanted a cake to match. She was able to create a cake for us off the opening screen shot of the TV program. The pricing was great for all the time and creativity she had to put into the cake. We would recommend Gabby for anyone looking for a cake designer. Great cake and Gabby was wonderful to work with!
author: Erin V.

description: I should've written a review earlier but life got really busy after my wedding in September! So this is a little overdue. Anyway, there is a reason why she gets 5 stars!!! Gabby came highly recommended (from friends and Yelp!) even before I started planning my wedding! When I met her, I knew exactly why. She is extremely personable, talented, and thorough. She owns the bakery and yet she takes care of ALL her customers herself - from the beginning to the end! When my (now) husband and I sat down with her, we told her what our vision was and she came up with a sketch within 30mins and nailed it. When we wanted to make changes, and update the design (I added designs from my wedding dress on my cake), she was very accommodating and even made amazing suggestions! Our cake tasting experience was super pleasant! Her cakes are fluffy and she has great flavors to pick from! We ended up with a four tier wedding cake and it looked amazing!!! My guests raved about how delicious it was. We could barely save the top layer lol. We were blown away! I loved working with her so much, she also made my traditional wedding cake - a 2 tier pillow cake (just based on pics via email!). We couldn't decide which one we loved more! Both were delicious. Overall great experience. Worth every penny!
author: Beth F.

description:
Gabby is wonderful to work with.  I wanted to have the "naked cake" look for my wedding cake and she told me that it dries the cake out.  She was able to achieve the look without disrupting the quality.  She created this beautiful cake that perfectly matched the theme of my formal backyard wedding.  She even added moss made out of sugar!
Her citrus cake is to die for!!
I also surprised my groom with a guitar cake, specially designed to look like the guitar he made.  This cake blew everyone away-and it was all super yummy carrot cake.
author: Mandy B.

description:
Ordered a cake for my SO's 50th birthday - sent over pics and ideas and they nailed it!

The cake was delicious! Moist and really flavorful. They packaged it really well and there was no issue with the transport - we drove all over SF getting ready for the party and the cake still looked great!

I would definitely order from them in the future. Thank you!
author: Christine S.

description:
We used Cake Coquette for our wedding at the Legion of Honor and we could not have been happier!  From the initial email all the way through the wedding day, Cake Coquette was a model of professionalism.  They would promptly email me back (if you are planning a wedding, then you know how important this is), the office where we met was clean and professional, and our coordinator, Talya, was absolutely wonderful.

At the initial meeting, we had brought some inspiration pictures of what we wanted and she sketched out a design while we were there, changing the design over the course of the meeting until we were happy.   She really listened to what WE wanted, and not what would be easiest for the baker (one of the other wedding cake vendors we visited was the complete opposite of this, I am writing her review next).  Also, the most important aspect of our decision to go with Cake Coquette was that the cake samples tasted great.  

As far as I know (we had a day of wedding coordinator) the delivery of the cake on the day of the wedding went smooth.  And when we finally saw the cake at the reception, we were amazed by how beautiful it was.  Many of the gusts mentioned how great the cake tasted as well.

I would book them for any other event in the future.
author: Matthew M.

description: We had a very particular kind of cake in mind that would require specific skills. After reviewing many online websites, we finally decided to ask around. We asked several different contacts and every one of them recommended Gabby at Cake Coquette once they knew what we wanted to do. We met with her and she gathered ideas and pictures and then sketched while we chatted and tasted 6 different flavors of her cakes. It turned out absolutely perfect and was delicious too!
author: Linda H.

description: What a wonderful company to work with from start to finish! The cake looked exactly like the sample photo we sent. It was delicious, moist and beautiful! Thank you for being so accommodating and easy to work with! Will recommend you in a heartbeat! Thank you Gabby!!
author: jessica g.

description: Gabrielle is amazing! My fiancée and I met her a few weeks before our wedding and she helped us design a perfect cake for our special day. Cake Coquette is conveniently located on Cortland Ave in Bernal Heights. The design studio was beautiful and inviting and the cake tasting the best part of the meeting! All of her samples were incredible, but we decided on a white cake with fruit filling for main layer, a hazelnut with chocolate ganache for middle, and a decadent red velvet for the top. Our wedding guests are still raving about the cake. I wasn't even able to freeze a piece for our one year anniversary because I couldn't resist finishing it! Thank you, Gabrielle, for such an amazing, yummy, work of art! -Jenny & Jennifer
author: Jenny D.

description:
Gabrielle is perfect!!
From the day I contacted her with a million questions about a wedding cake, she was always there to answer all of them. 
Cake came out absolutely perfect, I couldn't have been happier.
author: Anett R.

description:
operation soccer cake success!  thanks to gabby :)

situation:
1)  i live in socal and boyf lives in norcal
2)  his bday was sunday, dec. xx 
3)  i couldn't make it to his bday because i needed to travel for work
4)  needed a surprise bday cake for his dinner with his friends

mission:
look for a bakery to help me bake a soccer ball cake (sculpted cake) AND deliver cake to said restaurant for birthday dinner.

experience:
i was able to coordinate the cake, delivery, and payment all via email!  i didn't need to speak to gabby over the phone, everything was communicated via e-mail and so easy!  i appreciated that she didn't have a "minimum" like other bakeries i've reached out to and was so willing to accommodate to my requests and execute everything in 1 wk notice!

result:
operation soccer cake success!  the cake was delivered to the restaurant in time for his dinner and really took him by surprise ;)  he loved his cake and thought it was delicious!  the best part... he had NO idea!

turned out gabby actually made my cousin's wedding cake back in 2010 and from what i can remember, his wedding cake was delicious (red velvet and lemon).  so glad gabby was able to help me complete this mission with just 1 week notice!  though the cake was definitely not cheap, but coming from someone who's a professional wedding cake artist and for the surprise factor, it was definitely money well spent!
author: Alice C.

description:
Look no further. You've found your wedding cake designer. 

I did not sacrifice on design or taste, which is what I was worried about. 

I live in Southern California, so all communication was done through emails. Gabby was always responsive, professional, and informative. 

I sent her a photo of what I wanted and she was able to replicate it exactly as seen in the photo. 

There were a few hiccups: The cake was delivered at a later time, but it worked out for us. The sugar flower on top of the cake was supposed to be pink, instead of white. The middle tier was supposed to have coconut chocolate ganache flavoring, but it came with vanilla coconut filling. 

Her husband delivered the cake and he was so friendly! It just enhanced the experienced. 

We loved the buttercream frosting with cream cheese and strawberry/raspberry filling. Everyone was complimenting the flavor. My husband and I were fighting over the last piece! 

Fantastic experience and completely worth every penny.
author: Vanessa D.

description: I can't say enough about the amazing cake and service from Cake Coquette! I wanted a special birthday cake for my best friend's 40th birthday and they delivered a beautiful tiered Faberge-egg cake. My friend is Russian and she loved it as did all of the guests. Thank you Cake Coquette!!!
author: Tish M.

description:
Finally vegan cakes get their due! Cake coquette is an amazing bakery and talk about service!!! Two of my closest friends got married this past weekend 5/16. One of them is a full vegan and as a gift we decided to purchase their Wedding Cake. She had found Gabby and her staff at Cake Coquette, to make her petite 3 tiered "Vegan Chocolate Wedding Cake", and wow everyone was glad she did. The cake was delicious, moist, not overly sweet, and easily one of the best (maybe the best) chocolate cake, of any kind I have ever tasted and I grew up with a Mother who made Wedding cakes! It was beautiful and the taste was incredible! My husband and our family have had many negative run ins with "vegan and /or "gluten free desserts" but what Gabby created was delicious and so beautiful. The design was simple white fondant with royal blue piping, perfection! I will make sure everyone I know finds out about Cake Coquette! We have no gluten allergies in our family and we eat pretty much anything that is home prepared, ( my Husband and I like knowing what is in our family's food). This cake was not only delicious but it was also the single best experience I have ever had with a bakery. Normally, we have the cake arrive with the set up person, they find out where to set up they coordinate with the Florist and after a quick check in, they are done; this was not the case with Talya, Gabby's assistant!
I cannot possibly explain how helpful she was. 
With nothing more than a hastily sketched photo on my cell as a set up template, she completely helped us set up and arrange all the tables and the Wedding cake table correctly, inquired about flowers, and the Florist we went through in Sacramento where we live, had given us a few extra flowers in case something happened to my floral arranging skills, and we were able to incorporate the unused ones into the cake; making it even lovelier than it was and Talya didn't leave until everything was set up, 5 stars for service alone! 
But it was the taste knocked everyone for a loop, absolutely incredible! I am so happy my friend found and chose Cake Coquette bakery, I plan many, many, Weddings, this one was especially dear to me as they are such great friends of mine. Sometimes you have a neighborhood or little bakery for your go to even for your Wedding cake. But if you are "gluten-sensitive" or want to embrace a healthier or different culinary lifestyle, you can not go wrong with Gabby, Talya and all of the staff at Cake Coquette! Please do yourself a favor and at least give them a go, I have every intention of working with them again, if this is what "gluten-free" is, then I cannot wait to try as many of their recipes and cake tastings as I can!
Thank-you Gabby and Talya for everything, it was perfect!
author: Amber N.

description:
Gabby made an unbelievable cake for our wedding!!! Even though our cake was on the small side, she took the time meet with me and add all of the details we wanted (a tasteful Golden Gate Bridge, clouds made from small pieces of fondant cut to match the beads on my dress, and a perfect side detail on the bottom level showing a lego bride and groom covering the "lego" cake with fondant). All of these details were so personal to my husband and I, and they looked amazing!! Tons of our guests commented that it was the best wedding cake they had ever seen. 

Even more, Gabby was professional at all times, responding very quickly to the many emails I sent her. We met with four different cake people during the planning process, and I am so glad we chose Gabby. The cake was delicious and wouldn't have changed a thing!
author: A C.

description: The cake which I booked for my friend's birthday was awesome and it's exactly looks what I want! I was surprised when I pick it up.  Gabby really pay lots attention on the cake which makes my friend really like it! Thank you Gabby! :D
author: Nicky W.

description: Gabrielle did an amazing job on short notice to create a masterfully crafted cake that went above and beyond my expectations.  She was a pleasure to work with, quick to respond and extremely understanding.  I couldn't be happier with how the event turned out and the looks the cake got were wide-eyed and surprised.  My wife couldn't be happier!
author: William U.

description:
My husband and I were planning the reception to our wedding for memorial day weekend and we came across Cake Coquette because our original choice of baker was not available. Good thing we did!! We made an appointment to do a tasting and to give our design idea.

We had a superhero cake theme (more my idea) and while we were tasting and talking comic book movies Gabby sketched out our vision. The day of the event, everyone loved her design. We did not get a chance to thank her personally because she had other deliveries to make. We could not be happier with what she came up with and her prices were amazing for what we got. Her attention to detail and pride in her work shows. The cake was very delicious as well. 

If you are planning an event where you need a custom cake please choose Gabby and Cake Coquette. I have been telling everyone about her who sees the cake. 

Thank you again Gabby for your amazing work!!

Shawn and Shane
author: Robert Shawn W.

description: I am very sad to give Cake Coquette 2 stars. I was really hoping to have a good experience with them so I could hire them for my wedding next August. I hired Cake Coquette to design my Fiancé's 27th Birthday cake and I was completely disappointed. The reason I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 is Gabby was very fast in responding to my request and emails. The transaction process was easy and went smoothly and the cake even arrived 40 minutes early which was great. I was just disappointed in their execution, which is the most important. From their pictures on Yelp I know they are capable of producing a better looking cake. I believe they were busy and delivered a rush job. The cake was inspired by my fiancé basketball skill development start up. The jersey on the cake was not placed like I requested and the numbers on the jersey were put on very sloppy, the basketball on the cake looked cheap and his logo was digitally printed and looked horrible, which is not what I requested. I sent them a screenshot of his logo but I didn't think they would use that. It was just to give them an idea of what it looked like. If they were going to place a digital copy of his logo on the cake they could've asked me for a high resolution image. The cake colors were even wrong and were never verified with me. My fiancé thought I was going for a Golden State Warrior theme because instead of using orange, one of his company colors, the used yellow :( . They even placed stars on the cake which was totally kiddish for a 27 year old man. When I mentioned it to them they said they do it for a lot of their cakes, so if you don't want stars on your cake you better tell them specifically. The image I sent and through the design I communicated I never once mentioned stars. To me they just did a total rush job. The cake looked sloppy. They should've taken more time and put more effort into making my fiancé's birthday cake and they would have gotten several more orders from me including my wedding cake. The cake wasn't good either. It wasn't moist at all. Tasted very thick and was very hard to swallow.
author: Courtney C.

description: I contacted Gabby to see if she was able to make a Mickey Mouse birthday cake for my son's first birthday. She replied quickly and the cake was ready for pick up the day before. We had so much compliments on the birthday party! It wasn't only cute but also delicious! We will definitely go back to her again!
author: Becky N.

description: I ordered two cakes one for a baby shower and another for a birthday. I now know why she was so reluctant for me to go down to her shop and have a tasting. I paid literally more than $400 for the two cakes only to realize they were just some sugar and Jam crammed together. There was no taste to the cakes except sugar. On top of it despite numerous requests and emails from me requesting not to use fondant that is exactly what I got. A cake from whole foods would have cost 1/10th and would have still tasted better. Not recommended ever.
author: Neha S.

description:
I had an at home reception for my destination wedding at the Cliff House in SF at the end of October.  I had met with Cake Coquette around March to talk in detail about what we wanted for our wedding cake and to have a tasting.  Everything tasted wonderful and the customer service was great.  I really enjoyed working with Talya in their cute showroom in Bernal Heights.

So fast forward to the wedding reception day.  I've been telling my now husband for days how excited I am to see our beautiful cake.  It's supposed to be a 3 tier gold cake with an Art Deco/antique styling.  Just really unique, over the top, and decadent.  So I'm at the Cliff House setting up and crazed because everyone's pulling me to all different directions.  The cake comes in and is being set up.  I see it from afar.  My heart sank a little bit.  It was not what I was expecting or what was shown in my inspiration photo.  I wanted luxe, sophistication, jewels... What I saw was a bedazzled cake.  It was more animated than sophisticated.  Not to mention that one of the middle tier was uneven and leaning a little too much to one side.

I had a lot of hopes for this cake.  All in all, it turned out fine.  We still got compliments on it and it still turned out great in photos (in certain angles).  I really didn't have any issues with the customer service, they were one of the more pleasant vendors to work with.  But still thinking about the cake now makes me a little sad.  I had high hopes =(
author: Rica S.

description: Amazing job from an even more amazing person (Gabby)! this is long overdue but Gabby made our wedding for our 11-11-11 Treasure Island wedding! When people ask why I went with Cake Coquette first reason is you have to click with the creator, and she was very welcoming and understanding of what we wanted. Then, my favorite part, was the cake tasting session... I WANTED ALL THE FLAVORS but ended up with the salted caramel for two tiers and strawberry cream cheese (something like that) for the other 2 tiers! It was divine! Finally, delivery and set up was superb, no problems at all and she was super accomodating! Thank you again Gabby, people till this day LOVED my cake! Pictures will be added to Yelp Page!
author: Nida A B.

description: Cake Coquette delivered the most beautiful wedding cake I have ever seen!  My spouse worked with Gabby & Talya to try & explain what we wanted & they absolutely delivered!  We had wanted either succulents, thistle or lavender, on a simple white cake with buttercream frosting sculpted in the simple, but elegant "edgy" finish (I think they called it "horizontal swooshing").  They put together a gorgeous cake with succulents, lavender AND delicate, beautiful thistle.  Our guests all raved at the beauty of it & enjoyed eating it, too.  : )   We chose the devil's food chocolate with coconut on the top tier, and devil's food chocolate with mocha for the bottom tier.  They delivered it plenty early & it arrived in perfect condition.  We highly recommend Cake Coquette!
author: Rebecca M.

description: Everyone is still talking about our cake. It tasted great and was designed specifically to our nerdy desires. I would suggest them to anyone!
author: Corry F.

description:
Cake Coquette created the wedding cake of my dreams.  It was a beautiful cake!  All my guests loved the cake.  The staff is friendly and quick to respond to emails.  They were easy to work with and were able to adjust our ever changing guest list.   
I love Cake Coquette!
author: Chris F.

description: This was the second time i had placed an order with the Cake Coquette. First time the design and the taste of the cake was perfect and i decided to use the vendor again for my baby shower. Unfortunately the design of the cake was good but the taste was below average. The cake was not moist at all...and looked as if it was prepared days in advance as it lacked freshness.
author: Priyanka K.

description: Wife and I ordered a Sesame Street-themed cake for our son's first birthday.  It was absolutely beautiful but the taste and texture were not on par with its outer beauty.  Specifically, the taste was bland and the texture was dense and dry.
author: Nader Z.

description:
4.5 STARS

I ordered a small 3-tier cake for my wedding in September 2013. I loved loved loved the samples, and chose 2 flavors: salted caramel and chocolate, which were DIVINE. I was very pleased with their customer service; Gabby quickly responded to my emails, worked with our budget, and punctually provided her deliverables (samples, receipts, and the actual cake).

I'm so happy I ordered from Cake Coquette: I don't mind eating leftovers of that DELICIOUS cake. Our guests loved it too. I'm a chocolate fan, which is so common in most bakeries but I must say that it is the best one in town!

The only reason I'm not giving them a 5 is because the color of the cake was kinda off. The shade was on the darker side and not lighter as one would expect for a wedding cake. Although, I would have to give them credit for designing the cake exactly like the picture I had provided.

Overall, I would recommend Cake Coquette!
author: Michaella A.

description:
In all honesty I have not purchased a cake from them.  I was contacting several bakeries to get some pricing for my baby shower cake.  I received fantastic service from this place! The only reason I didn't get my cake through them was because it was a little out of my budget.  
I will definitely take this place into consideration if I ever need a large cake in the future. Customer service is very important to me thank you cake coquette.
author: Laura S.

description:
I found Cake Coquette on Yelp! I read all the reviews, looked @ the website and photos and contacted Gabby. She returned my call within the hour and we went forward with the design of the cake.
It was a big occasion, my monther's 50th Birthday and she LOVES the SF Giants. So my vision was to have a cake that looked like At&t Stadium!!!
 Being nervous for two weeks, my brother and I picked up the cake and.......WOW!!! I was beyond amazed and excited.
This cake made the party that much more special to my mom and all of our family who bleed Orange. I will forever go to Cake Coquette for all of my parties. For all the detailing and how well and yummy the cake was, it was well worth the price. Her pricing is great! Thank you for making my Mom's 50th one she will always remember!!!!
author: Sophia H.

description:
Gabrielle was fantastic to work with.  She met with us twice so we could design our cake.  Our wedding theme was Moulin Rouge and we wanted a cake that was different and unique.  She drew up several ideas and we ended up with an Eiffel Tower inspired cake. This was the centerpiece of our reception - and appears in many pictures of us dancing...

The cake tasted great and she was patient with us when we went back for a second set of tastings.  The lemo/citrus cake rocked and got rave reviews from our guests.
author: Mike R.

description:
The second my husband and I met Gabby, we knew she was The One. She was so friendly and seemed to know exactly what we wanted. Well, the day of our wedding came and when I looked out the window and saw Gabby walk up with our cake, I was simply amazed. It was even more incredible than I could have imagined and the best part was, it tasted absolutely amazing!! We saved the top layer and it was sooo hard to finish it, I wished it would have lasted forever. 

We had 3 flavors, chocolate soaked in coffee, vanilla with fresh fruit and salted toffee which was my favorite. I would highly recommend anyone to go see her for cakes of every occasion!
author: Melissa M.

description: I ordered a cake for my friend's 30th and C.C. made a replica of my friends' beloved dog for the top of the cake. They also incorporated the SF skyline and a local park where my friend walks her dog. The communication was prompt, concise and the staff/owner asked specific questions to make sure they made the perfect cake. The quality of the cake was excellent!! The fondant was edible and delicious (I don't really like fondant but I ate a lot off this cake). We got a chocolate cake with coconut creme and chocolate ganache - YUMMY! I picked up the cake on a Saturday and there was plenty of parking close by the shop. I would absolutely use this vendor again.
author: Elisa T.

description: I never write reviews but this one is definitely worth my time. I went to a bday fiesta at Fort McKinley's to celebrate my good friends bday and as much as I know this girl LOVES her some Louis Vuitton. I walked in the room to see this LV bag on a table and I got so  excited thinking it was going to be raffled and to find out it was actually her bday cake!!! WHAT!!!!  That cake bag was ON POINT...GORGEOUS and very well designed!!! Props to you Ms. Gabby girl you have it!!!! That Red velvet cake was delish! I'm just thinking up an event to create so that I can have a legit reason to have you hook me up, lol!!!  Louis taste GOOD!!! Deffinitely will be using you and reccomending you;-)
author: Que M.

description: Cake coquette is my #1 favorite bakery from now on.Gabrielle  made me some louis vuitton theme cupcakes for my birthday, and let me just say 5stars isnt enough to rate how delicious and beautiful they were.
author: Blanca H.

description: We had a vision for our NYE wedding cake and Gabby made it come to life. We wanted gold cupcakes with a mini gold cake for the top. It turned out so beautiful and GOLD! It was the centerpiece of the reception area and was perfect. It also tasted delicious!
author: Kristen C.

description:
Gabrielle did an wonderful job creating a cake for our wedding reception.  It came out better than we imagined, We received numerous complements about how beautiful it looked and then how delicious it was to eat.

Living in Southern California and arranging for a reception in San Francisco has challenges.  Gabrielle was right on top of everything, getting us clear ideas & suggestions about the creation of the cake, her opinion of the best combinations of flavors.  It was a pleasure to work with her & she was very responsive to questions and concerns.

When it all came together and the cake was delivered (exactly at the time promised) we were more than pleased.  We will definitely call upon the services of Gabrielle then next time we need a special cake.
author: ethan g.

description:
I first contacted Gabby by email back in July when I started planning for my October wedding in San Francisco.  I could have never imagined a more seamless transaction or spectacular cake, so all you brides-to-be out there, take notice!  Your search begins and ends here.

Residing in Long Beach, I didn't have the opportunity to visit many shops or talk to anyone in person. Armed only with a couple ideas that I wanted to incorporate, I basically needed to hire someone who made me feel like I was in good hands and Gabby more than delivered.  She was quick on the email responses, communicative and friendly....and once I told her my flavor choices and a couple ideas (ie "bindi-like design"...vague, right?), she assured me that she could make something delicious as well as beautiful.  The reviews on Yelp already speak for themselves, but I just wanted to add...I never ONCE spoke to Gabby.  All communication was by email. She was attentive when I needed her to be, and took the initiative to exercise the creativity I was hiring her for without bogging me down with details.  I know a lot of gals probably want to micro-manage their wedding details, but in my case, I just wanted to find someone trustworthy, say what I wanted, pay when I needed to, and let the professional handle the rest.

And that's exactly what Gabby did.  We ordered a vanilla buttercream with raspberry and strawberry filling with sugar calla lillies on top where a topper would have been (but I liked her idea better), it was delivered on time, it stood flawlessly at our reception for four hours, and the staff at my reception even told me at the evening's end that They loved cutting into her cake...(I guess some cakes create big probs...but not Gabby's!).  Totally delicious, beautiful, and classy.  Gabby is a true professional so my only warning would be to book her early because I imagine she will only get more popular.  Any time I end up in San Francisco here on out, I will celebrate the occasion with one of her creations.  I was quoted over $600 for the same cake at a couple other places...crazy considering I only had a party of 12. Designed and delivered for $220.  Again, unbelievable.  I feel like whatever good karma I've accrued in my life was paid off in spades by finding Gabby.    I never knew I could get so happy about a cake! :)

Thank you Gabby, for being the kind of gal I needed and wanted to work with, for making our wedding reception that much more memorable, and for your astute professionalism.  I am just bowled-over impressed!
author: L B.

description:
Considering all the 5 star reviews here, I ordered my wedding cake through Cake Coquette and it turned out to be the most dissapointing part of the wedding.

I wish this wasn't the case and I would have loved to give Gabrielle 5 stars, but it was tipping to one side so noticable that my guests called it the tower of Pizza. I will post a picture as soon as I have one.

Guests were happy we cut it, as they were worried it would fall by the end of the night. And when we cut it, it started moving so I was just holding my breath. 

We called Gabrielle early on when the reception started and she said that the table at the reception was not leveled.  She did not try to contact any one of us to tell us that ahead of time, instead, she just dropped off the cake and left.  

The staff at the reception facility brought a leveler to actually have me see that the table was in fact leveled fine, and that the cake arrived like that.

We called Gabrielle back to come and fix it, but she didn't.

Maybe this was just my luck, but please keep this in mind when choosing your cake maker.

Gabrielle's designs are beautiful and her cakes taste really good, but unfortunately, she should not have left the cake as is and should have done something to fix it.

Good luck to the rest of you; I hope your experience is better.
author: R R.

description:
Gabrielle is amazing! We have nothing but great things to say about our experience with her at Cake Coquette. 

My husband and I recently got married and had a small ceremony (~25 people) and a larger reception (~75 people) and Gabby made a DELICIOUS AND STUNNING small wedding cake for our ceremony guests and equally delicious matching cupcakes for the reception. The wedding cake was designed to match the lace of my dress and the flowers were delicate and beautifully crafted. I don't think the photos she has on YELP do her work justice. The cake flavor was red velvet, and both my husband and I are pretty particular about red velvet cake and this is some of the best we've had. Many of our guests asked where we got our cake because it was so delicious. Her fee was also very reasonable for the quality provided

We would HIGHLY recommend Gabby for anyone getting married. If you are looking for both taste and design this is the place to go!
author: Harmony S.

description: I had a baby shower for my daughter last Saturday and I ordered a cake from Gabby, I was a little nervous ordering a cake without tasting it but she was the one out of about 5 other bakeries I called that was able to do the design I wanted just two weeks before the event.  The reviews were great so I gave it a shot, I was so happy with her work and I asked to pick up the cake early because I had to drive a distance to start decorating the venue and she accommodated me without question.  The guests loved the cake design and taste, I did not personally get to try it but my family and friends said it was delicious!!  I will definitely order again from her without hesitation and recommend her highly.  GREAT JOB GABBY AND THANKS AGAIN!!!!!!!!
author: Linda A.

description:
I like theme dress-up parties.  So for my birthday I did a harajuku-kareoke night.

You simply can not do Harajuku with an average cake.  So I contacted Gabby,  I already sampled her goods at a tasting, and all I told her was "hazelnut - flavor harajuku". And she totally OVERdelivered. I squealed like a piglet when I saw it. WhEEEEE.

My beautiful cake was a metallic pink, complete with leopard-print accessories, swirls and hand painted bows, baubles and hearts. And when it came out of the box, I heard shouts of "Make sure you take a picture." and "Where did you get that?"

AND - "Is that fondant?"  and I was so proud and happy to exclaim - "Hell No. I hate that shit." It was, a delicious buttercream outside with  hazelnut inside. And the inside hazelnut cake matched perfectly - it was moist but not oily, flavorful and not sugar sweet.

And Gabby is a doll of a person and so easy to work with. Her cakes are beautiful and scrumptious.
I ordered a cake for my work birthday too.  Will update.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
The Cake Coquette's cakes are both beautiful and delicious. I highly recommend her!

Gabby, the Cake Coquette, made a cake for me for an event I had just recently, and it was superb. The vanilla cake was moist and delicious. The vanilla cream frosting was flavorful and had the perfect amount of sweetness. My guests raved about the cake - even those with very discerning pallets loved it!

In addition to making wonderful cakes, Gabby also replies to emails promptly and the business of designing and ordering a cake is very streamlined, clear and concise.
