I've tasted a number of cakes at events recently, in addition to tasting wedding cakes for my own upcoming wedding. Gabby's cake was, hands down, far more delicious and more beautiful than any I've seen. I can't wait to have another event for which I can order a cake from her.
author: E P.

description:
Cake Coquette is FANTASTIC !! Gabby is very helpful and attentive. I really satisfy for what she did with the birthday "car" cake. Surely the cake become centerpiece and guests were amazed. It tastes good too ! I really recommend her for anyone who wants to make an event special, as she doesn't charge a lot like the other cakery. Others will have some minimum charge and didn't want to go 'further' than the price should be. But Gabby is so wonderful, she would help you as far as she can. I have budget issue but I still want the cake looks good, and she is willing to add some more details. I'm sooooo happy with the result, more than I expected. =)

Thank you Cake Coquette for making my event memorable !!! For you guys who are trying to find a great place for a custom cake maker, definitely call her ! Don't wait and no need to look into others anymore..because I did already, and believe me Cake Coquette is the ultimate answer.
author: Jazzleen H.

description:
My wedding cake was not only a manifestation of my imagination, a beautifully crafted piece of artwork and a desirable mound of confection, but it was also sooooo delicious.
I am not a cake eater/fan, but this cake will have me talking about cake for years to come. It was so good, people. You need to use Cake Coquette as your wedding vendor, seriously. The cake was beautiful and the service, amazing, but, again, the cake was amazing....I can just taste it now. so good.
author: Michele A.

description: Absolutely spectacular!!!!!!! Speechless. Our guests were blown away by our custom wedding wine cake! I showed Gabby pics of the cake we wanted and she replicated it and and did an even better job! Her intricate details were unbelievable! Not only did it look awesome, my guests loooooovvveee the cake- they said it was the best wedding cake they've ever had! My mom can't stop talking about it, she had to load up a whole container full before she boarded her flight. Gabby- you have great talent & we admire your work!!!
author: Ennie L.

description:
Cake Coquette is the best deal in town! Gabby made a big, red number "1" for our business' first anniversary party this week. All the guests were wowed by the fancy look and taste of the chocolate cake.
I've also seen some of her other works - it seems like this woman can make a cake that looks like absolutely anything you want!

So, if you need to surprise your guests with exquisite, out-of-the-world design and delicious, buttery goodness, I highly recommend Cake Coquette. She was so imaginative and super-easy to work with, I can't wait for the next occasion to bring her in!
author: Sasha V.

description: Gabby saved our anniversary party with cool high class well finalized cake. Also delivered on time and trustfull credit card payment possibility made transactions smooth. Was very easy to agree also about cake size, design and taste with Gabby, she knows her stuff!! Thanks Gabby!!!!!
author: Petri K.

description: We ordered a wedding cake from Cake Coquette with a month's notice and without doing a tasting beforehand since we don't live in CA. While we were a little nervous about the approach, we shouldn't have worried - Gabby was very responsive, helpful, and accommodating regarding the timing, the design, and food allergy concerns. The cake arrived on time, looked absolutely perfect, and tasted AMAZING - I thought it was one of the best-tasting wedding cakes I'd ever had! We were so impressed that she created the perfect cake for us on relatively short notice and with minimal design guidance from our end. We would definitely recommend Cake Coquette for any special event, but particularly for a wedding - it was a treat to work with someone who made the process hassle-free.
author: Liz C.

description:
I am a special events coordinator for a restaurant downtown, and I have dealt with a lot of bakeries and seen a lot of cakes.  Gabby's are by far the best - hands down.  I have used Gabby twice now and both times the cakes were amazing!  The first was for a surprise 30th birthday party for my fiance, where I picked my flavor and sent gabby pictures of the venue asking her to compliment the theme.  She created a beautiful blue and orange art deco cake that was perfectly masculine and delicious.  
The most recent time was for an event I was coordinating at work where the theme of the party was "James Bond".  Gabby did a large round cake with a silhouette of Mr. Bond with Blood Dripping behind it and poker chips around the bottom.  It was perfect for the occasion and not over the top.  In addition to the beautiful, perfectly moist cakes, Gabby is very responsive, friendly and professional.  Great Service.

I will definitely be using Gabby for every cake I need from now on.
author: Ashleigh P.

description:
I was going to make my own wedding cake. Actually the groom was going to make the cake, but his seemed to come out dense like a fruitcake, and mine, well, I was confounded as to how one gets buttercream to be smooth (and for that matter, how not to burn your arm half off when pouring melted sugar and balancing your hand mixer and just overall panicking.) There are professionals for a reason, and with some relief, we committed to handing over this element of our wedding celebration to one.

Gabrielle of Cake Coquette made the cake of my dreams -- even now, it hurts me that I didn't have more time to just marvel at the beauty of the frosting work. She took the point of inspiration - a certain artist's abstract paintings - and rendered it in buttercream, adding the ingenious element of sprinkles for more texture. Not only was it unique, vibrant, but of course it was absolutely delicious. The raspberry vanilla flavour was not overly sweet, just right for the subtle-sweetooths of my asian family. The takeaway container's worth of cake kept me alive in the hotel the morning after the reception as we waited for room service to begin.

If you have a unique idea for your wedding cake, I highly recommend Gabrielle, as she has the hand and the eye to make it come out beautifully.
author: Sandy S.

description: When I say AMAZING!  I mean completely a 100% with a a doubt the best quality service I've ever experienced.  I first was in contact with a company called Sweet Lauren Cakes who mainly supplies Cake Pops. When Lauren received my inquiry into a cake that I needed done in less than two days she connected me with Gabby. When I mean GREAT SERVICE I mean Gabby literally was in contact with me the same evening. She agreed to making my custom cake that would normally take a week to complete. Unfortunately when I came to pickup my order Gabby had already left so I was unable to thank her. But the cake turned out to be PERFECT.  My friend so enjoyed her birthday especially the beautifully decorated cake. Such an amazing experience to have companies still go out of there way for the customer.  I will totally be using there services again and again and again!  This is the kind of service that needs to be duplicated and spread to other companies and organizations. ... Gabby is awesome! !!
author: Lila N.

description:
Shame on me for giving such a late review; we were married in April 2011.

Gabby is excellent. I highly recommend her. 

I LOVED my wedding cake.  It was perfectly designed, on time, and delicious.

She met with us and I described our theme, colors, and that I wanted a square cake. I loved it. She is professional and responds promptly. 

We had our cake top a year later and it was still delicious.
author: Angela F.

description: Gabby made a fantastic snowman cake for my baby's 1st birthday - Winter Wonderland theme!  The guests loved it and we were thrilled at how perfect it turned out.  Gabby was very responsive and helpful.
author: Cyn H.

description:
My fiancee and I are getting married in July '08 and have been looking at cakes.  We met with Gabrielle and she was very professional.  She provided a few books of her past work, which we were able to look through for ideas.  She was very much willing to work with out ideas and tastes.  Over all, her help and personal attention made it very easy for us to decide both on the cake we wanted and to choose Cake Coquette.

Oh yeah, and the cake we tasted was absolutely amazing.
author: Phil R.

description:
Gabby designed and made our wedding, and it was perfect!  We came in with two designs that we wanted to combine into one cake, and her final design was better than we even thought.  Her ingredients are high quality and the flavors were delicious! The cake was fresh and incredibly flavorful.  We received so many compliments on our cake and our guests even went back for multiple pieces!  The whole cake was gone at the end of our wedding.  

Gabby was very friendly, really listened to what we wanted, and incredibly easy to work with.  She has great attention to detail and awesome style. The cake was delivered on time and better than what had imagined.
author: Erica B.

description:
We did a cake buffet for our wedding in lieu of a large traditional cake, but we still wanted a small "topper cake" that we could cut for our pictures.  We decided we wanted an SF cityscape theme, and set about finding someone to make it for us.  Many bakeries turned us away due to the project being so small.  Others quoted us really high ($175 for a 7 inch cake - really??).  Gabby came back with the best estimate, and we decided to move forward with her due to that plus her stellar Yelp record.  At first we were a little unsure because her emails came across as a bit brusque and she only offers complimentary tastings to bigger-budget projects (we didn't want to commission a cake we hadn't tried).  However, once it became clear that we were legitimate customers who weren't just trolling for free cake samples, she offered us a reasonably priced tasting sample box, which contained one delicious flavor after another.  We chose one of the samples she offered, even though she said she'd work with us to do something custom if we wished, and commissioned the project entirely through email.  We sent a few pictures of examples of what we were thinking, and crossed our fingers hoping she'd be able to match the modern theme of our wedding and provide something that made the expenditure worth it.

Gabby absolutely nailed it.  The cake was beyond cool, and was everything we hoped it would be and more.  She listened to us and delivered everything we asked for, and even included a small moon and star embellishment on the top that really finished it off.  The cake was delicious, and it was a total showstopper to look at.  I will absolutely return to Cake Coquette for future cake needs, and would recommend Gabby unequivocally to anyone with cake needs large or small.  It seems that she is quite busy (a testament to her skill and quality of her product) so I would recommend getting in touch early to be able to work with her.  In an industry that often takes advantage of people through unfair markups, Gabby gave us a fair price, and explained in her estimate how the amount of work required related to the cost.  The cake she made was well worth it, and we couldn't have been more pleased with the product as well as the professional business dealings and the absolute artistry of her work.  Highly, highly recommended.
author: Sebastian B.

description:
Beautiful Monet-inspired cake. Incredible flavor!!! 
The cupcakes were perfect and the candy on top of the cupcakes in different shapes and sizes were the perfect compliment to the cake. Gabrielle made everything easy. Our guests were very impressed, my partner and I were impressed. Customers for life.
Thanks Gabrielle!!!
author: David J.

description:
Another awsome cake made by Gabby!  A beautiful Hello Kitty cake for my daughter's 4th Birthday,  Gabby was patient and thorough (as always).  We received SO many compliments on the look and the taste.  It was moist and not too sweet. 

As I said it before, it was Awesome.  I will be ordering from Gabby again!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Gabby delivered a fantastic cupcake tower designed perfectly to my specifications.  It was gorgeous and delicious!  It's was the hit of the party.  What a perfect dessert to celebrate my 50th!  She was a pleasure to work with and very accommodating and professional.  I will use her again when the need arises.  She also designed and prepared a small cake for my nephews 25th birthday.  He was ecstatic!  Thank you Gabby for helping to make this momentous occasion wonderful.
author: Betty A.

description: As a bride, my wedding cake was one of my top priorities. I spent a long time researching and cake testing. I settled with Cake Coquette because they had such great reviews but more importantly, they seemed as excited as I was about my wedding cake. Frankly, there was nothing worse than looking over pictures of cakes with a tired, uncreative cake maker who could not think outside the box. My experience with Cake Coquette was great from the start. I brought my ideas of what I wanted, brought a few pictures for inspiration and sat down to talk cake. After a short while, Tayla had drawn a sketch of a cake that had all the elements I wanted. It was like she waved a magic wand and my dream cake was suddenly on paper! The cake itself was delicious and I still think about it. The final product was splendid, just what I envisioned for my wedding. Tayla let me know that since she would soon be on pregnancy leave, Gabby, the owner would be my go to from the initial stage. Communication was very good after that and she was prompt with replying to my emails. The cake was delivered without a hitch and she set it up beautifully on the cake stand I had made. I could not be more pleased with the work and service from Cake Coquette. If you want a cake that is a true piece of art, look no further.
author: Gen W.

description:
I got married in November of 2013 in Stinson Beach and my experience with Gabby and Cake Coquette was one of the most lovely, reliable and DELICIOUS parts of the whole experience! I could not recommend this company more highly. 

Not only was Gabby flexible and prompt in her responses, as well as being able to work within my limited budget, but she made the MOST BEAUTIFUL and tasteful cake for my rehearsal dinner, and the most stylish/hip cupcakes for my sweet wedding.  

The best part of all, is that on top of them looking like the cream of the crop, it was SERIOUSLY the best cake I've ever had and we couldn't stop eating the cupcakes the days after. Definitely a highlight of the whole beautiful weekend.

My guests couldn't stop complimenting them and I couldn't have been happier! Thank you Gabby and Cake Coquette!!
author: Ariela M.

description: I got a Cake made for my fiancé's Bday and asked her to make a scary not wedding like at all cake and it came out perfect!! She made a zombie hand holding a chainsaw, coming out of the ground and blood splattered everywhere!!! To top it all off it tasted out of this world!!! Chocolate and mocha fudge . Wow! Such a great artist!!! everyone was so impressed.
author: Reagan H.

description: Talya is an amazing artist and a great person to work with!  I wanted to make a specialty cake for my fiancé for her birthday.  I came up with the idea of a cake that looked like a book.  I'd do the artwork for the "cover," and Talya would take care of the rest!  She was a great communicator as we emailed each other on a daily/weekly basis to make sure the artwork I made fit her specifications exactly.  The cake came out perfectly and everyone at the party absolutely loved it!  Thank you so much Cake Coquette!!!
author: Ryann W.

description: Gabrielle is awesome! I had a vision of how I wanted my wedding cake and she made it come true! The cake looked amazing but tasted even better! I am not the biggest fan of fondant and she assured me that her fondant would be better than what I've tasted in the past and she was right. Her fondant was light and thin and went perfectly with the overall taste. Everyone loved the cake and we were eating it for days without getting tired of the flavor. Gabrielle was so nice and easy to talk to that I would recommend for any occasion!
author: Vanessa M.

description: Gabby and her team created a cake in the form of an architectural rendering of a new building our school is constructing.  It was fabulous, and the guests at our annual gala event loved it!  We also ordered additional sheet cakes for our party of 500+ guests.  Gabby was wonderful to work with--she recommended flavors and knew how much cake we'd need for a party of our size.  The cake itself, was in a word, delicious!  I highly recommend Cake Coquette and would definitely work with them again in the future.
author: K G.

description: I ordered my wedding cake from Gabrielle and couldn't have been happier with the results.  I gave her a few ideas and inspiration pictures to run on and she took them so much further than I could have imagined. She created a cake that not only looked beautiful and elegant but also tasted incredible.  I should mention that I also have really high expectations for customer service and was so pleased with how quickly Gabby and Talya got back to me when I had a question, A++!  I recommend using Cake Coquette for all special occasions and can't wait to order my husband's birthday cake in a few months.
author: Leigh A.

description:
What can you say about a place that can take a simple thing like a cake and make it into a masterpiece!  

We were having a 65th Birthday for my husband's mom and I immediately knew who I was going to call when I heard that I was in charge of the cake!

Gabrielle has a beautiful talent and in my perfect dream world if I didn't want to own an animal rescue center then I would be in the cake business working for her!

The cake was so beautiful and I really hated to eat it!  We did get a lot of pictures before everyone dug in.  Not only does it look fantastic but it also is very delicious as well!

I find it fascinating the detail that goes into these cakes and how you can dress any cake up to look its best. 

Truly a priceless gift - we love your service and your talent and will be back for my Aunt's Birthday in December. 

Thank you for making your beautiful talent into something we all can enjoy! 

I definitely will be adding this place to the Sara D's Approved!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Fabulous, amazing, loved it! Everything.. from the presentation, the flavor and the service. 

I found Cake Coquette on Yelp. I needed a cake for my wedding. It was actually the only place I scheduled a a tasting with because they fit me in so quickly. The cake tasting was a success so why bother looking for others. 

I ordered 2 cakes.. One wedding cake and one grooms cake. Both absolutely stunning! All the friends called afterwards to rave.

If I could give them 10 stars I would.. Many thanks Cake Coquette for making my wedding even more special!
author: Monica S.

description:
Yup still 5 stars.  After the awesome wedding cake Gabby made for me a few months back, I knew I had to enlist her services for my husband's 30th birthday.

Through a joint kid-themed party for him and his best friend.  One of the absolute highlights was the 3 tiered cupcake tower for the boys.  I had some crazy notion that they could be decorated with the guys' favorties things.  I emailed Gabby some of my off-the-wall ideas, thinking she would rein me in on what she could actually create.

Well, she created every single thing I asked for (I'm still freaking stunned).  Here's the awesome candy pieces she made that topped the delicious cupcakes:
- a black goat (homage to HIMYM)
- UCLA logos
- faces of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
- the Green Man (It's Always Sunny...)
- snowboards
- Wii remotes
- Guitar Hero guitars
- AND the Puffy Shirt from Seinfeld.  

How she pulled it off...probably black magic.  Delicious black magic who's leftovers were still chocolatey and moist 5 days after the party.  Oh, and she was a great direction-giver when I called her frantically after getting lost on the way to the bakery for pickup.  Yay, Gabby!
-
author: Deidre B.

description: Gabby is simply amazing.  I'm not sure how many vendors have 5-star ratings on Yelp but Gabby clearly deserves the high marks.  She made a fantastic cake for us using the design we had and it turned out better than what we expected.  The cake itself was also very tasty - moist with just the right amount of sweetness & filling.  The frosting was a nice buttercream that was actually edible vs some other frosting that I've had on other cakes.  I would highly recommend Gabby for any special occasion cakes!!
author: T C.

description:
the cake that we got from Cake Coquette was absolutely incredible!

when we went to go see her, we talked a little about what we wanted the cake to look like etc.  Gabby was able to give us a bunch of suggestions and ideas to bring everything together and bring our ideas to life.  i thought that she would take a couple of days to come up with something, but she was actually able to come up with a sketch in *10 minutes*.  we couldn't believe it!  the sketch looked so great that we decided to go with her without even visiting any other cake makers.

on the day of the wedding, when we saw the cake, we were ecstatic.  it looked even more amazing than the sketch.  actually, we got lots of compliments from people on how beautiful it was.  and, the cake tasted great... i recommend the salted caramel... yum!
author: vlad k.

description:
If you want creavity for a special occasion cake make sure Gabby makes it.

Gabby def pays attention to details.  I told her the specifics of the birthday cake I wanted and it came out PERFECT. 

It tastes just as great as it looks. Thanks Gabby!
author: Sophia S.

description:
Oh.  My.  Gawsh.  My wedding was perfect!  I never thought I would be the kind of bride that wanted/needed perfection, but I was.  And it happened!  Gabby was a HUGE part of that.  

My husband and I met while working together at the Ferry Plaza farmer's market making coffee.  We made coffee on an older model Linea La Marzocco espresso machine.  Gabby recreated this espresso machine in cake form for our wedding party.  The whole night people couldn't believe it was a cake and NOT an espresso machine.  She also made another gorgeous cake for us that was the perfect compliment to our dessert bar.  

My only regret is that we had so much fun partying and dancing, we forgot to cut the cake until midnight!  Needless to say, we ate a ton the next day and it was DIVINE!  If you want/need perfection at your wedding, getting a cake from Gabby is a great place to start.  She will take your expectations and surpass them by a mile.  I will always look back on my wedding day as one of the best days of my life, and it wouldn't have been the same without Gabby.  It actually makes me want to cry thinking about it.  Thank you so much Gabby and everyone at Cake Coquette!
author: Sarah M.

description: Gabrielle was amazing to work with! The cake was just perfection, it looked just amazing and tasted even better! We sent her some pictures from Pinterest, and chose the cake flavors and paid the asking price, all by email! And, OH MY GOD! the cake was to die for! It was more beautiful than the picture and sinfully delish! We chose the devil's food with rasberry and I can recommend the flavor combo. Anytime we want to get an extra-special cake, we'll be looking to Gabrielle! Thanks for making my son's first birthday party so memorable!
author: Pia C.

description:
My fiance and I met with Gabby to discuss ideas for our wedding cake. I brought photos of our wedding space, cake ideas, photos of my dress, and color swatches for her to work with. By the end of the hour, she had a beautiful design sketched out and priced! She was really easy to work with and very enthusiastic about what we had developed together. We tried seven of her flavors - all really yummy! She's also really good with emailing as a primary form of communication - not all the cake designers I contacted when good with emails.  

We ended up not picking Gabby as our cake designer. For me, Gabby and the other designer were tied. I would have been happy with either one. My fiance made the final call. Even though we are not working with her for our wedding, I'd like to say that Gabby is an amazing baker/cake designer with real talent especially when it comes to buttercream frosting. The buttercream cakes in her portfolio are absolutely exquisite! And her cakes are delicious!
author: Waz W.

description: The cake for our daughter, Kristin's,  wedding last week was both amazingly beautiful and delicious!  The design was exactly as sketched for us and even more beautiful than we anticipated.  The cake was moist and very flavorful.  Thank you so much for making our special day even more so!!
author: Sharon S.

description: Cake Coquette and Gabby did a fantastic job on our wedding cake. We cannot be more thrilled about our experience with Gabby and the way the cake turn out. Gabby was very responsive and flexible in fitting my consultation when I first reached out to her. She is a wonderful person and a talented cake maker. I visited another popular cake designer in the SF area and her cake was by far better tasting, moist, and most of all, you can tell she put so much care and love in her work. We are very happy to have chosen Cake Coquette and Gabby to design our cake for our wedding and feel very lucky to have her cake as is certainly made an impression with our guests (some were asking for more to take home!!!)
author: Hsiang-Yi L.

description:
We picked Gabby to create our wedding cake back in November and it turned out AMAZING! Loved her, loved her cake and I had a room full of guests satisfied. 

FYI: Our flavor was the classic chocolate cake.
author: Lisa S.

description: Thank you Gabby for making my dream about wedding cake come true! :) My wedding cake is so pretty! Gabby was able to combine the elegance(my idea) with modern city skyline(my significant other's idea) seamlessly. I changed my order since I love the artsy feeling but my husband wants the symmetric look on the cake later on! Gabby was able to help and she really did make the cake into a piece of artwork! She even incorporated an image of America's Cup boat since my husband loves the race! :)
author: Anna S.

description: Ordered a cake for my daughter's fairy party...and it was fantastic.  My daughter just swooned over her flower cake and it was really hard for me to cut up the cake as I just want to keep it as is.  The taste was perfect....moist and not too sweet. I will have cake coquettes for my parties from here on!
author: Laureta R.

description: Absolutely fabulous cakes and cupcakes.  I called for a very last minute Valentine Day delivery and Gabby totally came through with an amazing creation that was both adorable to look at and delicious to eat (or so I was told). - Thanks Gabby!
author: Runt T.

description:
My friend brought up a good point today.  Who would give a bad review to their own wedding cake?  Might as well give the bride 3 out of 5 stars, right?

Well, guess what?  I am not even getting married, and I am giving Gabby, aka Cake Coquette, 5 enthusiastic stars.  You see, my friend is planning his wedding, and I, as his best man, try to help whenever I can.  I am sure they could have handled cake tasting on their own, but . . . come on!  Who knows more about cake than I?  In the words of Chris Rock, "fat people don't fail cooking classes."

You would be hard pressed to find a nicer and more patient person than Gabby.  It took my friend and his bride a long time to make a decision, and it probably would have taken longer if I hadn't been there.  (Sorry, I had to give myself a little plug here).  Every question we asked, every challenge we tried to throw at her, Gabby responded with "absolutely," "no problem," and "I can do that."

It's not surprising that we couldn't make up our minds, because every cake she showed us was truly a work of art.  If they look half as good in real life as they do in the pictures, I think the guests at my friend's wedding will be in for a real treat.

Gabby brought 6 cake samples for us to taste.  After much deliberation, my friend decide on a white cake with strawberry jam filling for one tier and a devil's food cake with hazelnut for their second tier.  If I had to offer some criticism--and wouldn't be a real Yelp review without it--I'd say that all cakes tasted pretty ordinary.  Don't get me wrong, they were delicious, but the taste wasn't out of this world.  I guess for a wedding cake you want to have something more agreeable, so . . .  Minor details.

The price she quoted us was very, very reasonable.  I mean, for the beauty she creates, and she makes every single cake herself, she could easily charge more.

Outstanding service, beautiful cakes and reasonable prices.  Check out her website and schedule an appointment right now (she doesn't have a storefront).  You will not be disappointed.
author: Yan G.

description:
Gabby is Amazing!!

She made my 30th Birthday Celebration Cake look like a Rockstar!!

Her cakes are YUMMY and she always give it 200% of hardwork!

Thank you. Gabby!!

You Rock!!
author: Emily L.

description: Gabby created a one-of-a-kind San Francisco-themed cake for my bday party. It was a beautiful masterpiece! The cake was a huge hit too -- everyone formed a circle around it and were in extreme awe while they gazed at it! The cake was delicious to boot!! It was just what I wanted.
author: Sfo O.

description: Just wanted to drop you a note to say THANK YOU for such a beautiful and DELICIOUS baby shower cake.  Of course it was the hit of the party and blended in with the decor.  Words like Beautiful, amazing and outstanding were words to describe the exterior of the cake and then when we cut the cake word like HEAVEN and lots of Mmmm Mmmmm good!  I was talking to one person as she ate and the cake so fresh that she couldn't pick it up with her fork!  I must say I had a time cutting it because it was so flaky!  Gabby was a breeze to work with, I basically sent her the photos of the baby bedding and it was on!  I hope when I get married or have a baby that she's still available and reasonable!!!  mmmmm I'm going to have a slice now!
author: Traybay J.

description: BEST CAKE EVER!!!! And I'm not a cake person. We ordered a cake for our wedding at the Zoo and we couldn't have been happier with Gabrielle and her beautiful work! We got so many complements on the taste and the artistic zebra/peacock design. I would definitely go back for another cake and recommend others to try it out! Once you taste it you won't want to go anywhere else!!!!
author: Shanan V.

description:
Where do I begin to start...  I love Gabby's creations too. :) The three layer cake that Gabby created for my three co-workers birthdays was magnificent. It had three different themes, the colors were perfect, the cake was delicious and of course the cake was ready on time...  Gabby responds to inquiries very quickly. I'm a very thoughtful person and I like for my cakes to have meaning and Gabby's creation definitely did the job.
Now I can't wait for another celebration!

Thanks again Gabby... 

I can't wait to see the heartbreaker's tiered cupcakes... Next month...
author: Sharae B.

description:
Gabby's cake creation for our wedding last week was TIGHT!!! My fiance (well, now wife...WEIRD) wanted a subtle 70's theme, so Gabby wove in green & orange flowers, and a cool pattern of modeling chocolate circles in different sizes. It was subtle and very tasteful. Long story short, she does awesome & tatsy work, and is very collaborative.

I love that she doesn't use fondant!! She's a self-professed icing obsessor....so no fondant, and instead just a smooth sea of beautiful and tasty buttercream.
author: Tony S.

description:
I'm so glad I found Gabrielle! My fiance and I had all but given up on having a wedding cake at all. We are both vegans and knew going into the planning process that our options would be limited. I realize that there are bakeries who offer vegan cakes, but I just wasn't inspired and dreamt of something much more elegant and unique than what I was finding. 
I was browsing pics of wedding cakes online just daydreaming of the cake I knew I really wanted, and found that just about every one I fell head over heels for was by Cake Coquette. So, I headed to the website to check out more. Everything was just so gorgeous! I decided to call and ask Gabrielle if she had ever made one of her cakes vegan.. she said she does!! I was thrilled.
Our tasting could not have been more relaxed or more delicious. Gabrielle put together such a tasty box of cake for us to try, and it was all vegan!! I still couldn't believe it. Not only that, but the sketch she came up with was beautiful. And, most importantly, it was "us". 
I can never thank Gabrielle enough for such a flawless experience and for making our wedding a day of dreams! Our cake made for such an incredible centerpiece, and I'm certain our guests ended up taking more pictures of the cake than of us ;) I couldn't have been happier.
author: Brigid K.

description:
Gabrielle makes delicous and magnificent cakes. They are real pieces of art. 

With no doubt, the best cake I have eaten in a long time!
author: Lydie T.

description:
I found Cake Coquette on here along with a few other places. I checked out her website for credentials and of course her photo gallery. Based on the work that she had done, I thought she was the right candidate. Though I have never met Gabby, she seem like a great gal with a good personality. My communication with her was only through emails and phone conversations. 

I watch a lot of Ace of Cakes on The Food Network, so when it came to one of my dear friend's birthday, my first thought was a sculpture cake. Unlike many of the reviews, my experience with Gabby was not for a wedding cake. It was for a cake with a New York Yankees theme to it. Basically, I did a lot of research of different images related to the Yankees online and try to put them all together in my head first before presenting it to her. I emailed her a few images and gave her notes under each image of how it will come into play as a whole design. I liked how she allowed me to stay control of what I had had envisioned and try to perfect it from there and not trying to persuade me into something else. She was a good listener, which made her very attentive to all my needs for the cake. I did ask to get a picture of the cake once she was done, but that's something she explained she doesn't do. I have to admit it was hard to let go and let her just handle the whole situation without knowing how it'll come out until the party. Anyhow, once the design was done, the rest was literally a piece of cake. I went on her website and choose her Classic Chocolate Cake as the flavor, which the cake would be glazed in coffee Kahlua syrup and filled with layers of mocha buttercream. Yums. The total cost of the cake itself came out to be $220 that fitted on a half sheet, plus an extra $40 for delivery within SF. 

The grand finale of the cake was obviously when it got revealed. Everyone was like ooooh and ahhhh about it, including myself. It was like the best birthday cake we had all seen! Way cool! The taste was absolutely wonderful. Mission accomplished. 

I do have to say that although the design and everything was great, it wasn't as great as I thought it could be. Come on, I am an Ace Of Cakes fan, of course I thought it would come out PERFECT. I am not saying it wasn't great, but I just that it could be even better, so this is why I'm not giving it five stars. But if I do have to do it again, I will still go back to Gabby because I know at least her work is great :)
author: Winnie L.

description: We choose Cake Coquette for the wedding cake of our Norwegian friends who got married recently in San Francisco after reading these Yelp reviews . Gabrielle Feuersinger is the easiest person on earth to work with, especially if you have the sense to simply let her own taste take the lead. Our bride reviewed Gabrielle's gallery, commented on elements she liked--the real flowers, the fabric ribbon effect (in frosting), and chose the flavors. When we arrived at the reception, the cake was in place and exceeded everyones expectations--and it was delicious. We gave her comparatively short notice, but Gabrielle was accommodating--and brilliant.
author: Peter P.

description: This review is long overdue, but I wanted to write about the great experience that we had. I got married back in March of this year and I ordered my wedding cake through Cake Coquette. My husband and I planned a small intimate wedding in a very short time. When it came to wedding cakes, we weren't sure about what we wanted. Thalia at Cake Coquette was very patient and made several sketches for us until we found something that fit our style and needs. We got so many compliments the day of the wedding. Cake Coquette created an amazing cake adorned with orchids in different shades of purple, I absolutely loved it! I totally recommend this place for anybody who is looking for a beautiful wedding cake.
author: Elena C.

description: Gaby is simply amazing.  She made a three-tier devil's food cake with fresh raspberries for our wedding.  She does not insist upon fondant like so many of her competitors do, but instead was able to do a buttercream for us with gorgeous, intricate piping.  Her pricing was on par with other personalized wedding cakes we looked at, but her quality was much, much better.  Honestly, we think Gaby should be charging more!  Highly recommended.
author: Tina H.

description: Gabby created an amazing cake for our wedding back in July 2010.  We wanted something non-traditional - a cake in the shape of a mountain with a high heeled shoe and a hiking boot on top.   She delivered an amazing cake complete with a waterfall, rocks, and greenery - it was art, but it was also delicious!  Our friends and family are still talking about it!  Gabby was easy to work with, understood exactly what we were looking for right off the bat, and on the wedding day, the cake was delivered without a hitch!  Thanks so much Gabby for a fabulous job well done!
author: Amy C.

description: i cannot say enough good things about Gabby.  She made an anniversary cake for my husband's and my 50th wedding anniversary.  At first Gabby said that the smallest three-tiered cake she made was for 130 people which was way more than we needed.  But when Gabby found out it was for our 50th anniversary and that this cake would be our first "professional" wedding cake, she said she could make a three-tiered cake for 30 people, which was just perfect.  I really wanted a three-tiered cake because we were married while in college and didn't have much money.  We were married at my husband's parents' home and his mother made my wedding dress and the cake.  The cake was good, but it was only two-tiered and did not have flower decorations.  I explained to Gabby that I wanted a cake with yellow roses and  purple violets because both of those flowers are associated with a 50th anniversary.  She make the cake exactly as i wanted it.  It was more than I could have expected!  It was gorgeous, complete with gold piping and a gold 50 on the top.  But, it doesn't stop there,  The cake was absolutely delicious.  The bottom layer was devil food chocolate with chocolate fudge filling.  The second tier was butter milk vanilla with carmel and toffee bits filling.  The top tier was red velvet cake with cream cheese filling.  Many guests said that it was the best cake that they had ever tasted.  THANK YOU, GABBY!
author: Barbara T.

description: Gabby is awesome. Totally professional, and a lovely person. And our wedding cake was more beautiful than I ever could imagine. And delicious (alternating layers of red velvet and citrus). She is an absolute artist. I will try to include a photo -- it is hard to believe that our cake had not a bit of fondant on it -- the buttercream was incredibly smooth, and the perfect backdrop for her wave design, all by hand. Thanks for making our cake so stunning and yummy!
author: Christi Z.

description: Everything about Cake Coquette was great until I tasted my wedding cake.  They are professional and the cake looked gorgeous -but I was very disappointed when I bit into the wedding cake and it was dry and flavorless.  Perhaps red velvet is not their specialty but, even so, I would expect much better tasting cake.  The cake was an important part of our wedding so I am very disappointed.
author: Sela F.

description: Gabby is amazing!   When we first met with Gabby we explained that we had an art deco "themed" wedding  - venue, etc.  Before our eyes she sketched-out the perfect, most beautiful cake.  Come our wedding day, the cake was everthing we thought it would be and more.  Thank you Gabby for you beautiful and delicious work of art!
author: Adrienne V.

description:
Miss Gabrielle made a cake for my partner's 40th birthday party last night.   It was the most gorgeous thing I have ever seen, a black and white cow sitting a field of tall grasses and you would not believe the face on this cow, TOO cute!!!!   Someday I will get it together and post a picture of it - but trust me - FABULOUS!
It was a spice cake (as that is my gf's fave) and totally delicious.   There was another designer cake at the party, and the cow stole the show, hands down.

If you are looking for a special cake, no matter the occasion - look no further and call the lovely Cake Coquette!!   Gabby is so easy to work with and a really nice person on top of it - which to me is always a bonus.   No, you don't have to like everyone you hire in life, but isn't it nice when you do?    

I am running out fabulous things to say so just go check out her website and when you go for  a tasting, try the spice cake for the love of god.   It had a cream cheese filling people.........cream cheese!!!!    

I might have to go have my mid-morning snack of left over cake now...yum.
author: Jen p.

description: Wow, what a spectacular creation Cake Coquette created for my father's birthday!  I asked for Van Gogh's Starry Night in cupcakes and that is definitely what I got.  Van Gogh has never looked so delicious!  The artistry and detail was fantastic, and the price definitely reasonable for such a creation.  Best of all, Gabby was quick to answer all of my many questions in advance via email, never taking long to respond and answer thoroughly, which made the customer service experience wonderful.  Everyone was awed by the cupcakes and the artistic colors were so appropriately intense that we had ongoing contests to see who could get their tongue the bluest.  And the gold frosting that comprised the cupcake frame?  Incredible.
author: Rebecca K.

description:
All of Gabby's creations are delicious and artistic. I have had many of her desserts from small pastries to elaborate wedding cakes and every time I am torn between eating them and admiring them as the works of art that they are.

I've had her make cakes for several work functions, and she has been great in helping to create a cake that will meet the needs of all the people in the office (I like chocolate but my boss likes white cake), reflect the personality of the company (we are bunch of tech guys and the idea of having a custom cake made for an event seemed a bit girlie, until they saw the final product), and be something completely unique.  

If you are in need of a special occasion cake Gabby is your girl!
author: Matt G.

description:
Gaby made a REALLY beautiful and delicious cake for our wedding in Sept 2010!!

I didn't have any specific ideas for the design and she quickly helped me decide on an amazing and creative design based on her ideas and pictures.  All of the cakes at the tasting were delicious and we found her prices to be very reasonable.

The wedding cake looked and tasted perfect, and all of our guests loved it.  We had a 3 tier cake and also a sheet cake, and we used 2 different flavors.

Also - Gabi was super friendly and very easy to work with! Definitely recommend her!
author: Barbara L.

description:
My husband and I offered to make arrangements for a wedding cake as our gift to a young couple. Our friends had a lot of fun sampling different cakes and vendors. At the end, Cake Coquette.was chosen as a maker of a special event cake.
Everything seemed to be perfect until I saw a final fruit of the labor displayed on the reception table - CROOKED!
Since the cake was my gift  to the newly wedded couple and the most anticipated part of the evening, I called Gabrielle in hopes she can assist in fixing the out of shape tower. I was amazed when she answered the phone and told me the table she left the cake on was crooked.....
Why would an experienced baker, who charges additional delivery & set up fee, leave a tower cake on an uneven surface? Why wouldn't  Gabrielle call me with alternative suggestions for a set up? Thankfully, the cake survived before it was cut. Unfortunately, not too many pictures were taken.
10 guests at my table were served lemon - butter cream cake which was way too dry and sweet. I do have pictures of the leftovers.
author: Anna R.

description: I can't express how much I loved the birthday cake Gabby produced for my bf's 30th bday.  I asked for a cake with  a somewhat unconventional theme - I wanted it to look like a burning cigarette (yes, he's a smoker) and Gabby produced the most realistic (scarily so) giant burning cigarette cake in history (unclear whether she set a precedent with this one).  She was also marvelous in dealing with my crazy schedule - I was travelling 2 weeks beforehand and returning 3 days before the day and we managed to arrange everything over the phone in 2 conversations.  The only complaint would be how after we brought it out, the birthday boy was no longer the center of attention - but who can compete with a giant burning cigarette cake??
author: Olivia S.

description: I was in search of something special for my GF's 30th, lo and behold Cake Coquette! I knew I would be in good hands when I read about the custom zombie massacre cake she did for a client.  With very little direction and a relatively short turn around she turned out an incredible Sloth themed (GF's fav animal) masterpiece.  It made her cry tears of joy!  This my friends is the power of fancy cakes.  Highly recommended and would use her services again!
author: Chris G.

description:
I love cake and visual design is my expertise so finding Gabby was a gem! Gabby did a beautiful cake for us. It looks and tastes spectacular!

Gabby was also very patience and open to design ideas I had about the cake. On the special day she placed fresh flowers on the cake which is a bonus service that  you will not get if you went  with the other bakery.

Overall, I am pleased to have chosen Gabby after tasting and looking at four other vendors.  Order your cake from Cake Coquette because it will be as memorable and tasteful as the event you want to celebrate for!  Gabby is one of the most talented and friendly cake designer I have ever met.
author: trang v.

description:
I was referred to Gabby of Cake Coquette by my wedding planner, Alison Events.  From our first meeting, Gabby was always a pleasure to work with and very responsive to my emails. She created the most beautiful and delicious wedding cake for my September wedding. It was exactly what I wanted!!  She replicated the design that I had used throughout my invitations and programs and coordinated with my florist so that the cake would have beautiful flowers on it as well.  As I told Gabby when I thanked her the next day, I was just glad the cake table was right next to the head table so that I could easily admire it! 

Thanks Gabby!
Jocelyn of SF
author: Jocelyn B.

description: We chose Cake Coquette to design and make our wedding cake and it was perfect!!  We met with Talya and by the end of our meeting she had already come up with a great sketch based off our invitations.  The cake itself was super delicious and Gabby created a unique design that was totally original.  They are super easy to work with and at a great price.  Can't recommend Gabby enough!!
author: Nicole T.

description:
Although we didn't get to eat much cake at our own wedding on 8/22/09, other than the ones that we smashed into each other's faces, we heard great reviews from our guests on the chocolate layered and lemon layered cake that we ordered from Gabrielle.  We also thought our cake was BEAUTIFUL.  To stay within budget, we originally wanted something very plain - just offset white squares in 3 tier with a navy blue rim - but Gabrielle suggested adding an orange paisley element from our wedding, in just small accents around the cake - and she sent me a lovely sketch to illustrate it.  I adored it, and she was SO reasonable about adjusting the pricing so that it STILL stayed within our budget that it was a no-brainer!  We had some orange flowers in key places on cake too, but I didn't think it needed more than a little flower topper, it was so nicely iced.  

We also regret that we didn't get to go to our own tasting, because we planned our Santa Clara wedding from 3,000 miles away in Boston.  But Gabrielle had no problem doing a sampling for our friends, who reported to us that she was so sweet, all her cakes were so delicious and pretty, and they she was hands down the best option of 3 places that we sent them to.  Clearly you can't go wrong with Cake Coquette!  Delicious, gorgeous, creative, flexible and professional!  I will add a picture when I get them and if I can figure out how!
author: Alice C.

description: Gabby did a wonderful job making us a beautiful AND delicious wedding cake. Since then we have had her make us cakes for every special occasion. She is so accommodating for me, who is gluten free. Her gluten free cakes are the best I have ever tasted!
author: Nicole P.

description: It's not just that her cakes are tasty, but check out the artistry (http://www.cakecoquette.com/gallery.html) Gabrielle is a true cake diva, artist extraordinaire.  Deep dark chocolate is my favorite (the BEST for chocolate lovers!) And she's good people, easy to work with.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Getting a cake from Gabrielle is a wonderful experience!   I had the opportunity when I ordered one as a wedding gift for my sister (for the event of course).  My goodness, though I had seen her portfolio, she went above and beyond in creating the most beautiful work of art ever -- and it was delicious.  If you check out her website, it is the photo on the "order" page; pretty yellow buttercream flowers all over with green vines, the layers filled with real fruit ...  

She is truly a professional who is passionate about her creations.  One can tell she loves her job, as her excitement shines through when she works with you to create the MASTERPIECE!!!
The process is fun and I cant wait till I have another opportunity to eat more cake & support such a great business and wonderful person.
author: Adriana G.

description: Gabby did a FANTASTIC job on our San Francisco themed wedding cake. it was more amazing and unique then we could ever had imagined! We hated to cut it because it was so beautiful.  Everyone was raving about the cake, and it was so tasty. The bridge, buildings, and Giants logo was perfect. We let her work out the artistic details with little directions and it was great. Gabby was very responsive to emails and was very easy to work with. My husband still talks about our tasting which was one of his favorite wedding activities :)
author: Yvette M.

description: I recently ordered a theme cake from Cake Coquette which turned out amazing!  I spoke with Gabby over the phone and she easily interpreted my idea in the form of a cake that was the talk of the hotel in which I had my event!  It tasted great too!  Don't bother going anywhere else!
author: Kelly E.

description: When Gabby walked in with the birthday cake she created for the 30th b'day soiree that I was sharing with one of my bestest friends, I was overwhelmed at how perfect this cake was.  She somehow was able to take the little bit of direction that we gave her (our favorite cake is yellow cake with chocolate frosting) to make us a cake that was better than anything we could have imagined.  This cake looked amazing - 3 layers, white frosting, perfectly round polka dots, and my favorite part, a giant gold 3-0 on top.  I was like a little girl with a new bike, I had to show this cake off to everyone that walked in.  Sadly, we eventually had to cut into this masterpiece, but we discovered that not only did it look fantastic, it was also yummy - yellow cake with chocolate filling, and buttercream frosting...delish!  I have received so many comments on our cute/beautiful/fun/tasty cake that I know we absolutely made the right choice in having Gabby create a cake for our entry into club 3-0.
author: Sheryl D.

description: It was wonderful to work with Gabby for our wedding cupcakes. She made exactly what we wanted and everyone them! They looked beautiful and tasted sooo good too. We highly recommend hiring Gabby for any cake occasion!
author: Jessica K.

description:
Oh Gabby... i love you more than cupcakes! Gabby is incredibly creative, helpful, and talented! Not only are her cakes absolutely gorgeous, they taste WONDERFUL too! I will never throw another party without one of her creations there! I threw a bridal shower for my best friend and we did a cooking themed party, so Gabby made a three tiered cupcake cake with little cooking utensils on every cupcake! It was so gorgeous, no one wanted to eat it, but when someone finally did try one, they were gone instantly, moist, not too sweet, and to-die-for frosting... (that can make or break a cupcake, duh!)!
Gabby communicated with me all via email because of our busy schedules, but she was very responsive and helpful.  She was an absolute delight to do business with. And for her intricate designs, she is incredibly affordable! Everyone loved the cake so much, the bride is having Gabby do her wedding cake too! She truly knows the meaning of customer service and satisfaction! Thanks Gabby for making my party!
author: Crystal F.

description: A group of us were celebrating in the wine country for one of my friends birthdays. She is gluten intolerant and I needed to find a cake kind of at the last minute. I called Gabrielle and she made a cake within one day for me. All of my friends were totally impressed especially my friend who was celebrating her b'day. Gabrielle is very artistic and the cake was gorgeous. She asked me if I wanted a traditional cake or a modern cake. I said modern and let her go to it. It was a chocolate care and was truly outstanding. My friend who has had many gluten free products said that it was one of the best cakes she has had. Thank you Gabrielle!
author: Rachel M.

description: Well I met Gabby today picking up a beautiful cake for my aunts 45th birthday party .  It looks spectacular It was more then I thought. She took an idea that I gave her over the phone with no pictures or anything and brought it to life.  Gabby is delightful and honest you will get your moneys worth.
author: Dee Z.

description:
I went to a birthday party last night and they had the most delicious cake there, made by none other than the cake coquette.   Fluffy chocolate cake with the BEST frosting in the world, seriously the best.    It was gorgeous too, made to look like a page from a scrap book and the detail was just amazing.  

Did I mention the frosting was really really good?
author: Gabriella R.

description: What can I say that has not already been said:  Gaby is brilliantly creative.  I am convinced she can turn ANYTHING into a cake.  I opted for an Art Nouveau themed wedding cake, with blue metallic flourishes and flower accents which she fully delivered on.  The wedding cake was stunning, tasted great, and her prices were WAY better than anyone  else I spoke to.  She was truly a pleasure to work with at every step along the way.
author: tina t.

description: Gabby created cakes for my office a couple of times. One for a baby shower (which had colorful polka dots and cute little baby shoes). The other for a birthday (gluten-free with perfect script and intricate roses). The designs were fabulous and tasted even better...especially the gluten-free cake. Even if you aren't allergic to gluten, you should sample one. It's like pure fudge. Heaven! Gabby is a delight to be around and wonderfully creative. If you need a custom cake, Cake Coquette is the only way to go.
author: Matt M.

description: Great cake bakery. I purchased a wedding cake for our niece, last month. I even delivered it to the wedding. Coquette made the wedding cake perfect to order with a couple of nice extra creative touches. They packaged it nicely so I could drive it in my car through the San Francisco streets unharmed. Guests loved the cake. The wedding pictures came out great! Auntie did well for her niece, thanks to Cake Coquette.
author: Peninsula F.

description:
Gabrielle has made several cakes for me now, and I have never been disappointed.  Most recently she made a cake for a Graduation party. We gave her a swatch of our table cloth fabric and asked her to make something that went with that them. When she arrived with the cake, I was amazed how perfectly the colors matched, she added some great touches and style to it, while keeping with just what we wanted. 
The cake was absolutely delicious as well. There was not a bit left, except for the piece that i tucked away for myself! ( Her butter cream frosting is the best!!)
On top of all that, Gabrielle has alway been extremely professional and a delight to work with.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Ok, clearly I'm the anomaly here when you look at the other reviews, but you'll just have to take my word for it that I'm not a crazy bridezilla, just a moderately disappointed, but very reasonable, bride.  

So, the short story is:  the cake was delicious, the price was reasonable, the design was ugly, and Gabrielle was really hard to communicate with.  For long story, see below.

We hired Gabrielle to design the cake for our wedding last month, and I will just say now that I had no problems with how the cake tasted.  We had two different kinds of cake, and our guests kept saying how much they loved both of them.  The price of the cake was also very reasonable.  The design of the cake was another story.  

To put it bluntly, I thought it turned out pretty ugly.  Which really surprised us because we'd seen Gabrielle's portfolio and all of her cakes were gorgeous.  Based on the pictures of her work, we were happy to tell her the look we wanted for our cake, and let her work her magic for the execution.  We sent her many images of what we wanted and emailed her several times about the design, but she was surprisingly hard to get in touch with.  She wanted to conduct everything by email--which I get--but that made it really difficult to hammer out the design details.  She sent a sketch of her ideas (after I had to ask for one) and it really didn't match what we were looking for.  We sent her an email pointing out things we thought could be different, and she seemed to get the idea.  However, when we saw the cake on the wedding day, it basically looked like her original sketch, which we'd hated.  And putting aside the fact that we didn't like the design in the first place, the work itself didn't seem up to her usual standards.  There was a lot of edging outlining things on the cake and it all looked pretty sloppy.

Based on her other glowing reviews, I have to think something went wrong our weekend--she was overbooked, or hated us, or thoguht our design was tacky, or I don't know what.  My advice would be to really, really have a clear idea of what design you want and to be hands-on from the beginning of the process.
author: Sarah G.

description: Seriously amazing cake!!!!  Gabrielle did my wedding cake for me last week.  She was really easy to communicate with and was more than willing to work with a bride from out of state.  She let me change my mind as often as I liked and delivered the cake and set it up at my venue!  It was delicious red velvet with cream cheese frosting!  Book this gal, she is super talented and great to work with!
author: Sarah L.

description:
Gabby did a marvelous job on our wedding cake! I couldn't wait to see it and when I did I was sooo happy with it. 

She did a Topsy Turvy Mad Hatter style cake for us with patterns that incorporated our favorite things (including turtles) and our wedding theme. 

Not only did it look great it tasted super yummy too ( from what i heard since i only got 2 bites but my 2 bites of lemon was heaven!!! ). We had 2 different flavors - lemon & mango... now I wonder what mango tastes like... one can only dream...

She was super nice and easy to work with and did i mention talented? Our cake topper was sooo cute ... sugar people of us and our dog :) 

Couldn't have asked for a better cake or cake lady  =) Thanks Gabby!!!
author: Tubbi H.

description: Gabby is incredible at what she does. I had her make a cake as a surprise for my husband's 30th birthday. I wanted it to resemble a golf course he had visited for an early birthday celebration, and she captured every little detail perfectly. He absolutely loved it, as did everyone else at the party-- both in looks and in flavor. I would definitely work with Cake Coquette again. Thanks, Gabby!
author: Andrea V.

description: If you're planning a special occasion, book Cake Coquette as fast as you can for a spectacular and delicious dessert. And I can't stress the delicious part too much. Gabrielle isn't just a brilliant artist, she's a master baker as well. I know this because I was lucky enough to attend an event where she provided the dessert.  It was awesome. And no "attitude" from the chef, either. You'll never meet a nicer person. She's wonderful to work with and the results are spectacular.
author: Robin A.

description: The owner Gabrielle was very nice. The tasting was fun and gave us a chance to exchange ideas; she is very open to creating a cake that incorporates your design ideas. I showed her a picture and she came up with a totally original way to turn it into a design. The cake was delicious and a unique work of art.
author: Karen S.

description: AMAZING!!  Cake Coquette made a cake for my 9.26.09 wedding and it was simply breathtaking.  My husband sent her a picture of our inspiration and Gabby's creation blew the cake in the picture out of the water.  The sugar flowers atop the top tier of the cake were unbelievable.  My mouth literally dropped when I saw what a beautiful cake she created.  And it tasted yummy too!!  Thank you!!!!!
author: Jessica A.

description: Gabrielle took on a cake design (six triangles with rounded corners in a hexagonal array, covered in fondant to look like game pieces from our game, Trism) that many other cake designers had felt would be too challenging or incredibly expensive...and delivered it perfectly, on time and at a reasonable price.  Great job, would definitely come again for any special cake needs.
author: Rob S.

description: Gabby was so easy to work with. My fiance and I picked up a sample box containing a dozen small cakes for tasting for $15.00. We decided on which flavor we liked (it was tough competition cause so many of the samples were super delicious), we gave her a picture of the wedding cake we found online and that was it! When the day arrived, the cake came in looking super beautiful and tasted absolutely delicious. All our guests LOVED it. I would highly recommend Gabby's services and will definitely utilize her services for myself in future.
author: Sal S.

description: Gabrielle's cakes are fantastic!!  And she is a pleasure to work with!  Our wedding cake was beautiful, tasty and budget friendly.  :)  Definitely recommend!
author: ashlea t.

description:
I was planning a birthday party and so I called Gabby, the extraordinary cake designer and owner of Cake Coquette, and asked: Could you design a cake with a bamboo or zen-like feel? Wait, no could you do a cake with champagne flutes, and stars? Hold on, I think maybe something with a lot of confetti or flowers? Decisions, decisions... I had no clue. Imagine my questions when it came to deciding cake flavors. Gabby was a rockstar! Not only did she suggest and create a gorgeous cake design - bamboo garden with ornate delicate flowers - but also she made the most delicious cake flavor - kahula mocha chip. My party guests were amazed when they saw (and tasted) the cake. The conversation usually went something like this:
Party guest: "Wow, where did you buy the cake?"
Gabby: "Actually, I made it."
Party guest: "What, you made this, it's incredible. Really, you made this...it's beautiful. Lauren, did you know she made this?"
Me: "Yes, I know, that's why I called her."

So definitely call her, when you're planning your next event and want that extra special touch! And Gabby - Thank You!
author: Lauren B.

description: Wow! Gabby at Cake Coquette is truly amazing. For my sister's birthday, we ordered a cake for 30 guests and Gabby helped us design a fabulous, delicious chocolate cake with butter cream frosting. The cake looked too good to eat; it was  a piece of art! We couldn't stop staring at it throughout the night.  Did i mention that the cake was perfect in every way? It was moist, and the perfect sweetness as well as visually stunning.  Gabby was so easy to work with- I will highly recommend her to anybody who needs a cake and will definitely be calling her again for the next celebration!
author: Michael G.

description:
gabby made my 30th bday cake and it was a HIT!! the chocolate with coconut cream cheese frosting was to die for and the design of the cake was just gorgeous...(i'm attaching a picture if i can figure it out!)

gabby was super friendly and met with me for a consultation where we discussed the different options. she was professional-- had her portfolio with pics and all-- and very insightful and thoughtful about what would work best. i definitely appreciated her knowledge as i hadn't ever personalized a cake before. 

if you want yummmmmmy cake with a stunning design (simple or amazingly intricate) cake coquette is the place to go!!! i highly recommed her for any special occasion or just your birthday cake! it will be a blast and she'll make it a very memorable event!!!!!
author: boon l.
